Lidia is 35-years-old, married and has a 10-year-old son who is attending school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and the house she lives in is her property.

Lidia sells cosmetics of various brands, an activity she’s been carrying out for the last five years.  She also prepares and sells food in her mother’s business.  She works there half-days Monday through Saturday.

This is the first loan she’s taken out in the communal bank and will use it to buy chicks to raise and then sell thus starting up a new business.  Her goal is to grow in the chicken business.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Sector 3 María, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

La Señora Rosa nos comenta que se encuentra gozando de muy bien salud al igual que están todos los miembros de su familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta pollos, cuyes y cerdos, ha elegido esta actividad como método de vida hace 2 años porque esto le da buenas ganancias y puede estar pendiente de su familia.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra cerdos y alimento para sus animales. En la cancelación de dicho crédito no tuvo dificultades y realizo los pagos en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de una chanchera y seguir creciendo en este negocio.

La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que existe en el grupo, por las charlas de educación que reciben en cada reunión y la atención personalizada que reciben por parte del promotor de crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Sector 3 María” communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Turi Parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known for the beauty of its church and also because one can view a large part of the city of Cuenca from there.  Its people are nice, kind, tenacious and hardworking.  They work in commerce, animal husbandry and agriculture.

Rosa comments that she is enjoying good health and everyone in her family is too.  She raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs to sell.  She’s chosen this activity as a way of life for the last two years because it produces good profits and she can watch after her family.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy pigs and animal feed.  She had no problems paying off the loan and made all her payments on the designated days.  She will use her new loan to build a pig sty and to continue growing in this business.

She likes the communal bank because the group has team spirit, because of the educational talks they get at each meeting and for the personalized attention they get from the credit advisor.

loans.use: to build a pig sty.

loans.name: Miriam Mercedes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 13 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual además de vender  artículos de bazar también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y zapatos aunque esto en menor cantidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos los va a comprar a Guayaquil cuando necesita surtir su negocio y también recibe mercadería en su local de otras partes. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por cuatro años y que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios ingresos.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa bien arreglada y ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the “Valroc” communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets locals produce that are renown throughout the country and for the warm-heartedness of its kind, hardworking people.

We met Miriam, 40, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 18, 16 and 13 years old.  The oldest attends University and the younger ones attend secondary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend has a store at home where besides selling household items also sells all types of clothes, Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) and shoes although these in smaller amounts.  She works every day from 8am until 7pm.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs to stock her store and she also receives merchandise at her store from other places.  She tells us that she’s been in business four years and is doing quite well.

This loan is to buy household items, perfume, cream, cosmetics, clothes and shoes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 4 years and likes it because she used her initial loan to start her business which now allows her to earn her own income.  Her dream is to have her house fixed up nicely and to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hortencia Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hortensia, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve  hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa y estudia en universidad, con ella también viven una hija que es madre soltera junto a su hijo pequeño. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de cibercafé y cabinas telefónicas, negocio que lo tienen en su casa para lo cual adecuaron un local, allí  además también venden útiles escolares y enseres de oficinas, bocadillos de picar, sodas, jugos de frutas y otras golosinas, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h000 hasta las 21h00, en este negocio también ofrecen el servicio de trabajos en computadora, el cual le deja muy buenos ingresos ya que viven cerca de un colegio, también venden tarjetas y recargas de teléfonos móviles. Nos cuenta que llevan 16 años dedicados  a esta actividad y gracias a esto han sacado adelante a su familia.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una computadora nueva ya que una está descompuesta y esto le resta ganancias. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que este crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the “Valroc” communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets locals produce that are renown throughout the country and for the warm-heartedness of its kind, hardworking people.

We met Hortensia, 63, here.  She’s married and has nine adult children.  The youngest of these still lives at home and is attending university.  A daughter who is a single mother and has a little boy also still lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend and her husband have an Internet café and telephone booths business, a business they have at home and for which they set aside some space.  They also sell school supplies, office supplies, snacks, soft-drinks, fruit juice and other snacks there.  They work every day from 8am until 9pm.  
They also offer computer services in this business which produces very good income since they live near a school.  They also sell mobile phone cards and recharges.  She tells us that they’ve been doing this work for 16 years and thanks to it have been able to move their family forward.

She will use this loan to buy a new computer because one of them is broken and this reduces their profits.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goal is to continue forward with the business and that it grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa, amable y muy trabajadora. Tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, con quienes vive, al lado de sus nietos, en la casa propia que pudieron construir gracias al resultado de sus trabajos.

Su trabajo consiste en la confección de ropa, elabora las prendas a pedido, pero también hace otras que ella misma diseña. Se dedica a esta actividad más de 15 años, pero lamentablemente después de muchos años de trabajo tuvo que tomar un descanso de unos meses debido a un problema de salud; sin embargo, desde hace un año ha retomado sus actividades laborales y ahora lo hace con muchas más ganas porque es su pasión y se siente muy feliz cuando observa que su inspiración culmina en una hermosa prenda confeccionada. Está muy tranquila porque sabe que su trabajo le permite generar sus propios ingresos y no depender del dinero de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo la coloca como una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad, se siente útil siempre, aunque asegura que no le agrada mucho elaborar pantalones de varón por el tiempo y la dificultad que le demanda. Espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho más grande y destinar un espacio únicamente para la venta de sus creaciones.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 47 years old.  She is a very determined, kind and hard-working woman.  She has three adult children with whom she lives, alongside her grandchildren.  She lives in her own home which she was able to build as a result of her hard work.

Lidia's business is making clothing.  She makes garments to order but also makes other items that she designs herself.  She has been in this business for more than 15 years but unfortunately, after many years of work, she had to take a few months rest owing to a health problem.  However, she re-started her work a year ago and now she is working even more keenly than before because this is her passion and she feels very happy when she sees her inspiration turn into a beautiful item of clothing.  She feels calm because she knows that her work allows her to make her own income and she does not have to depend on her children's money.  What Lidia likes about her work is that she is able to capture in a garment the design which inspired her.  The ease with which she creates new garments makes her one of the best dressmakers in the city.  She always feels useful.  However, she says that she doesn't really like making men's pants (trousers) because of the time and difficulty that it involves.  She hopes to soon be able to build a much larger sewing workshop and to have a special space just for selling her finished products in.

This is LIdia's first loan from MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity she is being given and the trust that is being placed in her.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Lidia enjoys being a member of her community bank because she has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.

Lidia will use the 700 soles that she has requested to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, lace and lycra.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex tiene 29 años, es un joven alegre y bromista, pero sobre todo muy trabajador.  Su pareja desde hace 13 años es Sandra, de 29 años, juntos tienen cuatro hijos de 11, 6, 3 años, y el último bebé tiene recién 5 meses de nacido. Viven en la casa que pudo construir en una parte del terreno de su suegro.

Su trabajo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado al por mayor. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para comprar los pescados a los pescadores ambulantes que ofrecen sus productos frescos en el puerto pesquero de la ciudad. Selecciona los mejores para luego llevarlos a su almacén donde los congela, luego los coloca en sacos herméticos para, finalmente, enviarlos a otras ciudades. Realiza esta actividad todos los días desde las 4 de la mañana y termina aproximadamente a las 10 de la mañana. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 13 años con la ayuda de dos miembros de su familia. Durante las tardes se dedica a conducir su motocarro, desde hace 2 años, únicamente los días en los que no termina muy cansado del negocio de los pescados. Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque siente que ayuda en la difusión de las especies pesqueras que existe en los ríos de su ciudad, además se alegra mucho porque promueve la conservación de los mismos rechazando y dando aviso a las autoridades cuando observa pescados cuya venta no está apta para el consumo, ya sea por el tamaño o por la temporada de veda. Espera más adelante poder exportar sus productos en mayor cantidad.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) incrementará su capital para comprar más pescados para enviar a otra ciudad.
texts.en:
Alex, 29, is a cheerful young man who is full of fun but above all is very hardworking.  His partner for the last 13 years has been Sandra, 29.  They have four children together who are 11, 6 and 3 years old; the youngest is a 5-month-old baby boy.  They live in a house he was able to build on part of his father-in-law’s lot.

His work consists in buying and selling fish at wholesale.  He rises very early every day in order to buy fish from fishermen who sell their fresh catches in the city’s fishing harbor.  He chooses the best ones to then take to his warehouse and freeze.  He then places them in vacuum sealed bags to ship them to other cities.  He does this activity every day starting at 4am and finishes around 10am.  He’s been in business for 13 years with help from his family members.

For the last two years he’s been spending afternoons when he’s not too tired from the fish business driving his car.  He likes what he does very much because he feels that he helps to make known all the species of fish that thrive in rivers in his city.  He’s also very glad to promote conservation of them by rejecting them and informing the authorities when he observes fish being sold that are not fit for consumption either because of their size or because it’s during the season when they are banned.  He hopes later on to be able to export his products in larger amounts.

This is his first MFP loan and he’s very happy to know that he has financial support because he’ll feel surer about making progress in his work.  He also commits to make his payments punctually.  He’s very happy to belong to his communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.

He will use the requested 700 soles to increase working capital and to buy more fish to ship to another city.

loans.use: to buy more fish to ship to another city.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis es un hombre de 26 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante y muy trabajador. Es soltero y aún no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres al lado de sus seis hermanos. Junto a toda su familia va en busca del progreso y de mejorar su situación económica para consolidar su futuro.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de granos (maíz, arroz y frijol), así como carne de cerdo, pollo, res, etc. Todos los días se dirige al puerto principal de su ciudad, muy temprano, y ahí identifica a los productores y ganaderos. Denis compra a precios muy cómodos y los vende a personas ocasionales o para almacenes de la ciudad. Trabaja en esta actividad durante 5 años y desde que empezó no ha encontrado alguna dificultad, por lo que su trabajo lo desarrolla con mucha tranquilidad y con muchas ganas. Eventualmente, se dedica a conducir motocarro haciendo transporte de pasajeros, realiza este oficio hace 4 años y le va muy bien también. Para el futuro espera poder tener su propio almacén en el que pueda vender mucho más que ahora.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará mayor cantidad de granos y carnes para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Denis, 26, is a man who very much wants to get ahead; he’s very hardworking.  He’s single and has no children yet.  He lives in his parents’ house alongside his six siblings.  Together with his entire family he seeks progress and to improve his economic situation in order to secure his future.

His work consists in selling grains (corn, rice and beans) as well as pork, chicken, beef, etc.  He heads out very early every day to his city’s main port and picks out the producers and cattlemen.  Denis buys at very affordable prices and sells to individuals or to stores in the city.  He’s been in this line of work for five years and has not had any problems since he started because he does the work very calmly and with much dedication.

He also works occasionally as a mototaxi driver providing passenger transportation.  He’s been in this business four years and does quite well too.  In the future he hopes to have his own warehouse where he can sell much more than he does now.

This is his first MFP loan so he thanks those who make it possible.  He’s very committed to make his payments punctually and responsibly.  He’s happy to belong to his communal bank because all the members are good, kind and mutually supportive.

He will use the requested 700 soles to buy larger amounts of grains and meat to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy grain and meat to sell.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 31 años, es una mujer optimista y muy trabajadora, ama mucho a la familia que formó con Henry, de 36 años, con quien tiene una relación de pareja desde hace muchos años. Fruto de su amor tiene dos hijos menores que los impulsan a ser cada día mejor. Vive en la casa de sus padres y todos los días se levanta con muchas ganas de hacer las cosas bien para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Su principal trabajo es la venta de comidas típicas, tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado más concurrido de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho cocinar, es por eso que no duda en preparar y poner a la venta todos los días los platillos más deliciosos que caracterizan a la región tropical de la selva del Perú. Prepara los mejores guisados y los caldos más ricos, es por ello que todos los comensales que acuden a su puesto culminan sus alimentos muy satisfechos y agradecidos, acompaña sus potajes con las bebidas más refrescantes elaboradas de las mejores frutas de la zona. Su rutina empieza todos los días a las 4 de la mañana y culmina pasando el mediodía. Desde que se inició en esta actividad trabaja sola, hace aproximadamente 3 años y desde entonces ha visto con gran emoción el proceso de crecimiento por el que ha tenido que pasar para consolidarse en la preferencia del público. Para el futuro, espera tener un restaurante donde pueda vender la comida que prepara durante todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad, por que actualmente solo lo hace por la mañana, no obstante espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos como hasta ahora.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 600) comprará los ingredientes e insumos que necesita para continuar preparando sus comidas. También implementará su puesto comprando algunas mesas y sillas que le hacen falta para recibir a más clientes.
texts.en:
Karina, 31, is an optimistic, very hardworking woman.  She loves the family she's formed with Henry, 36, very much.  They have been a couple for many years and their love for each other has produced two minor children they encourage to be better every day.  She lives in her parents’ house and every day gets up with a strong desire to do things right in order to improve her living conditions.

Her main work is preparing traditional food.  She has a stand in the city’s busiest market.  She likes cooking very much which is why she does not hesitate to prepare and sell her delicious dishes typical of the tropical Peruvian jungle cuisine every day.  She prepares the most delicious stews and soups which is why everyone that comes to eat at her place finishes their meals satisfied and very appreciative.  She accompanies her dishes with the most refreshing beverages made from the best local fruit.  

Her daily routine starts at 4am and ends after noon.  Since she started this activity about three years ago she’s worked by herself and since then has been very excited to see the growth process she’s had to go through to become a crowd pleaser.  In the future, she hopes to have a restaurant in which to sell the food she prepares throughout the day with more tranquility because she currently only does it during the morning.  Notwithstanding, she hopes that all the effort she exerts will produce good results like to date.

This is her first MFP loan.  She’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she will feel surer of advancing with her work this way.  She commits to make punctual installment payments.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 600 soles to buy ingredients and supplies she needs to continue preparing her meals.  She will also furnish the stand buying some tables and chairs that she needs in order to be able to handle more customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food and tables and chairs for her food stand.

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en: The loan of USD 900.00 from HKL and Kiva will help Hiek, who is 33 years old, succeed in her granite mortar-and-pestle making business. Heik and her husband help each other in producing mortars and pestles in order to make income for the family. Recently, they ran out of raw materials (granite stones), which is why Hiek has applied for a loan. Together, they are able to generate income around USD 4.00 per day and use it to cover their daily expenses. Hiek has been engaged in the business for almost 20 years. She is now a mother of three school-aged children, who still need daily allowances from her. Hiek hopes that she can send all of her children to attend university after they finish their education at high school level.

loans.use: to purchase granite stone for mortar-and-pestle making business.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Thuch's photo was taken in the HKL branch office in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 58 years old, a widowed woman and has two children. Both of them are already settled in marriage and live separately around Kampong Chhnang Province. Thuch earns a living by dedication to a rice farming business and weaving bamboo baskets. She has been doing this for more than 30 years and earns approximately USD 3.50 per day. 

Right now, Thuch is busy with her farm work and she needs additional capital to invest in her farming business. Due to the shortage of funds, Thuch would like to ask for a loan in the sums of KHR 1,300,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor costs incurred in plowing. This loan will help her to manage her business well and she hopes that she will be able to have a fruitful crop in harvest season. For her business goal, she intends to purchase extra farm lots to increase her rice production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor costs incurred in plowing.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Na is 42 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of purchasing coconuts to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Four of her children are employed. They earn about $12 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Na is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more coconuts to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 32 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fortune teller who earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier. He earns about $5 per day. Because her present house is too old and about to collapse, Pov is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Laizamon

texts.es:
Laizamón tiene 60 años, es un hombre honrado, humilde y muy trabajador. Su pareja desde hace 35 años es Edith, de 56 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, ya mayores de edad. Vive con toda su familia en su casa propia, la que construyó con sus propias manos, por lo que se siente muy orgulloso de haberle brindado a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir.

Su trabajo consiste en la fabricación de mesas, sillas o cualquier otro mueble de madera y en la construcción de casas y cercos. Es muy reconocido en su sector por la calidad y la rapidez con que ejecuta sus obras, siempre es solicitado sobre todo en temporadas de invierno que es cuando las casas de su barrio sufren algunas deficiencias o requieren alguna refacción. Él se encarga de esta actividad junto a tres personas que lo ayudan a hacer el trabajo. Lleva más de 25 años y le gusta mucho crear viviendas o muebles que se vean hermosos. Cuando no tiene contratos de construcción trabaja al lado de su pareja en el puesto de venta de verduras que establecieron juntos hace 20 años y que también es su otra fuente de ingreso. Tiene una chacra de donde algunas veces se abastece de los productos que ponen a la venta. Aunque reconoce que su trabajo le ha permitido conseguir el dinero necesario para solventar sus gastos familiares, siente que los años de intensa actividad están produciéndole cansancio, es por eso que desea dedicarse al negocio de la venta de verduras junto a su esposa porque considera que es más tranquilo y no tiene que pasar días completos bajo el sol trabajando en alguna obra. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro, lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) comprará algunas herramientas de uso común en su trabajo y surtirá su puesto de venta de verduras comprando productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Laizamón, 60, is an honest, humble, very hardworking man.  His partner for the last 35 years is Edith, 56, with whom he has four children who are all adults now. He lives with his entire family in his own house that he built with his own hands.  He feels very proud to have given his children a place to live in.

His work consists in manufacturing tables, chairs or any other piece of wood furniture and in building houses and fences.  He’s very well-known in his sector for the quality and speed of his work.  He’s always sought-after above all in winter which is when houses in his neighborhood are damaged or need repairs.  He takes care of this work with the help of three people who help him.  

He’s been in business more than 25 years and he very much likes to create houses or furniture that looks beautiful.  When he does not have any building contracts he works alongside his spouse in the vegetable stand they started together 20 years ago and that is another source of income.  

He has a piece of farmland he uses sometimes to stock up on products they sell.  Although he recognizes that his work has allowed him to earn the necessary money to cover family expenses, he feels that the years of intense work are taking their toll on him which is why he wants to concentrate on the vegetable sales with his wife because he considers it to be more tranquil and he does not have to spend entire days working in the sun on some construction site.

This is his first MFP loan so he’s grateful for the opportunity and trust being given him.  He commits to make his installment payments punctually.  It pleases him to be part of the communal bank he belongs to because he’s seen that the members are responsible, supportive people.

He will use the requested 500 soles to buy some commonly used work tools and to stock his vegetable stand buying products at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work and vegetables for his stand.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn is a 48-year-old married woman who has been residing with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a few plots of land for farming and also manages a small off-license at home for additional income. She works hard in order to help her husband, a construction worker, to raise their two children. The children are now out of school and help their parents earn income because the family is experiencing financial difficulties. Her older son decided to work as an industrial laborer in a neighboring country, Thailand.

Chhorn’s house is under construction and therefore she needs additional capital to get it finished. As of now, she is asking for a loan of KHR 600,000 to supplement her existing money to purchase timber and wooden wall boards. She hopes our lender will continually help her family as it’s now her fifth cycle loan from HKL. She paid off her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to purchase timber and wooden wall boards.

loans.name: Kim Han

texts.en:
Kim Han is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of purchasing cattle to resell. She earns approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

One of her children is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Kim Han is requesting a loan of $1000 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more cattle to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family

loans.use: to raise capital in her business for purchasing more cattle to resell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, es una mujer honrada, amigable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 37 es Ernesto, de 61 años, con quien tiene seis hijos, de los cuales, el último es menor de edad y aun está en etapa escolar y depende de sus padres.

Su ocupación principal es la venta de comestibles de consumo diario como verduras, frutas, huevos y algunos abarrotes. Para ello, todos los días coloca una mesa en la vereda de su casa donde ofrece sus productos. Su mercadería la obtiene del mercado de la ciudad, al por mayor, selecciona las verduras más frescas para sus clientes. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hijo lo ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas labores del hogar. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 5 años y le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos en su propia casa. Por otra parte, hace 14 años, pero solo por algunas temporadas se dedica a la venta de pescado al por mayor. Forma parte de una asociación de vendedores que se encargan de exportar los mejores ejemplares de pescados de los ríos de su ciudad. Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque con las ganancias que obtiene puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos básicos de su hogar. Por eso espera instalar, más adelante, una bodega en la que tenga más artículos para vender.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera responsable y puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y muy cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) comprará mayor cantidad de comestibles de primera necesidad para ponerlos a la venta y empezar el abastecimiento de su puesto.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, is an honorable, friendly, and hardworking woman. Her husband of 37 years is Ernesto, 61, with whom she has six children. The youngest is a minor who is still in school and dependent on his parents.

Her main occupation is selling foodstuffs for daily consumption such as vegetables, fruits, eggs, and some groceries. Every day she places a table on the sidewalk in front of her house to sell her merchandise, which she buys wholesale in the city, selecting the freshest vegetables for her customers. Usually she works alone, but sometimes her son helps out when she has other household tasks to do. She has been doing this activity for about 5 years and likes the ease and convenience of generating income from her own home. For 14 years, she has also sold wholesale fish, though only during certain seasons. She belongs to a group of vendors who export the best fish from the city's rivers. She really loves what she does because her income helps her husband pay the household expenses. In the future, she hopes to set up a bodega where she can offer more items for sale.

This is her first loan cycle with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity offered and the confidence invested in her. She promises to make her monthly payments responsibly and on time. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank because she has seen that the members are caring and courteous. She will use the requested loan (S/. 500) to buy larger quantities of foodstuffs to sell and begin stocking her stand.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 15 years. Nelia earns more income from pig fattening and poultry.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additonal dried fish to sell

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 33 años, es una mujer amable, alegre y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 16 años es Pastor, de 34 años. Fruto de su amor tienen dos hijos menores, de 16 y 5 años. Construyó su casa en una parte del terreno que le ha cedido su madre, ahí comparte sus días junto a su familia quienes la impulsan a seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta diaria de helados de hielo y bebidas. Vive en una zona en la que el calor extremo juega a su favor, ya que sus clientes acuden a ella para comprarle las refrescantes bebidas que necesitan. Acondicionó un pequeño local en la casa de su madre para realizar este trabajo, su mamá vende comida y esto se convierte en una oportunidad perfecta para realizar la venta de sus bebidas. Tiene este negocio hace 3 años y ello le ha permitido brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario en sus estudios y cuidados. Al principio le fue complicado porque no tenía dónde congelar sus bebidas, afortunadamente pudo comprar su propia congeladora y superó el percance, ahora todo marcha bien y sus planes de crecimiento continúan.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará más bebidas para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Magaly is 33 years old and is a kind, happy and hardworking woman.  Her partner of 16 years is Pastor, who is 34 years old.  As a result of their love, they have two children, both minors, ages 16 and 5.  They built a house on a part of the land that her mother has given to them.  There she shares her days together with her family who propel her to get ahead and to better her quality of life.

Her work consists of the daily sale of frozen ice cream snacks and drinks.  That she lives in an area of extreme heat plays in her favor as her clients already come to her to buy the refreshing drinks that they need.  She converted a small area of her mother's house to carry out her work.  Her mother sells food and this became a perfect opportunity to implement the sale of drinks.  She has had this business for 3 years and it has permitted her to provide for everything necessary for the care of her children and their studies.  At first it was complicated for her because she didn’t have a place to keep her drinks cold but fortunately she was able to buy her own freezer and overcome this hitch.  Now everything is going well and her plans to grow continue.

This is her first loan with MFP, therefore she is very grateful to those who are making it possible.  On the other hand, she is very committed to complying with the punctual payment of her installments very responsably.  She is very pleased to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very good, kind and supportive of each other.  With the amount requested (S/. 700) she will buy more drinks to continue to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to continue to sell.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 10 years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband (who appears in the picture with her) is a veterinarian who is also involved in breeding pigs. He earns about $17 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kunthea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more piglets to breed for resale when they gain weight, thereby earning more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to breed for resale when they gain weight

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica tiene 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Tiene una relación desde hace 7 años con Jesús, con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años, a quien ama con todo su corazón. Actualmente vive junto a su familia en la casa de sus padres y juntos hacen todo el esfuerzo para salir adelante.

Su trabajo es la elaboración de cigarros artesanales comúnmente llamados “mapachos”. Estos cigarros son fabricados usando como materia prima el tabaco que también es obtenido de manera tradicional en especie de barras macizas o fajas compactas. Este insumo lo obtiene comprando en algunos almacenes de la ciudad o a personas que solo lo venden por algunas temporadas, es por eso que cuando encuentra el material tiene que comprar en cantidades altas para poder estar abastecida. Para elaborar los cigarros corta manualmente el tabaco en pequeñas hileras y luego las coloca en papeles, finalmente los enrolla, los agrupa de diez en diez, y luego los vende en pequeños paquetes, al por mayor. Trabaja en este negocio todos los días, desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó  ha tenido siempre el apoyo y la colaboración de su madre. Le gusta mucho su actividad porque le genera los ingresos necesarios para poder sobrellevar los gastos de su familia; sin embargo, reconoce que al principio no le fue nada fácil porque no tenía clientes, pero gracias a la recomendación de sus amigos logró conseguir personas que le compren y ahora le va muy bien.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de tabaco para mantenerse abastecida de su materia prima.
texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old and is a fighter, an entrepreneurial woman and very hard working. She has been in a relationship with Jesús for the past seven years. With him she has a 6 year old child whom she loves with all of her heart. She currently lives with her family in her parents house and together they make the effort to get ahead. 

Her work is making artisan cigars which are commonly called "mapachos". These cigars are made using the raw material of tobacco which is obtained from a traditional method in solid bars or compact bands. She purchases this material from stores in the city or from people who sell it during certain seasons. For this reason when she finds the material she has to buy it in large quantities to be supplied. To make the cigars she manually cuts the tobacco into small strands and then places them in papers, she finally rolls them and groups them in tens. She then sells them wholesale in small packets. She has worked in this business everyday for the past three years when she began to have the support and collaboration of her mother. She likes this work a lot because it generates the necessary revenue in order to handle the family expenses. However, she recognizes that in the beginning it was not easy for her because she did not have clients. Thanks to her friends' recommendations she was able to acquire customers who buy from her and now it is going very well for her. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very content to know that she has financial support because with it she will feel more sure of advancing with her work. Also, she is committed to complying with on time payments of her loan. She is also very happy to belong to a communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive. 

The amount requested (500 soles) will be invested in the purchase of tobacco in order to maintain a supply of this raw material. 
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de tabaco para mantenerse abastecida de su materia prima.

loans.use: to buy tobacco to make the cigars that she sells.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is from the village of Marannao. She is 52 years old. Delia is single. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell at her store in the community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Delia is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase further additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 28 years old and married with two children.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, and school supplies.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, and school supplies.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en: Bunthorn is 62 years old and lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is widowed and blessed with a daughter. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and vegetables for more than two years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. Bunthorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase bamboo to build a trellis for cultivating cucumbers and bitter gourds. This money will help her expand her business and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to build a trellis for cultivating cucumbers and bitter gourds

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

Nora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Nora has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla tiene 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable. Su pareja desde hace 9 años es Limber, de 49 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en su casa propia, la que pudo obtener gracias al resultado de su trabajo, ya que ahorró mucho tiempo y colaboró con su pareja para la construcción de su vivienda. Sus hijos la apoyan económicamente, ya que todos trabajan y ponen todo de su parte para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella desarrolla varios trabajos, de acuerdo a la temporada. Está la venta de plátano, en otras ocasiones pescado; sin embargo, su principal actividad es la venta de gaseosas, cervezas y gelatinas en su vivienda. Desde que se inició en esta actividad, hace aproximadamente 2 años, ha trabajado sola y ha visto con gran emoción el proceso de crecimiento por el que ha tenido que pasar para convertirse en la tienda favorita por sus clientes. Para el futuro, desea tener su propio puesto de ventas de productos comestibles y principalmente anhela construir su propia distribuidora de bebidas, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor comodidad y rapidez. Aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en este trabajo, siente que todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene, no obstante espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos como hasta ahora.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) comprará mayor cantidad de gaseosas y cervezas para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Leyla, 44, is a very hardworking, honest, responsible woman.  Her partner for the last nine years is Limber, 49, with whom she has four children.  She lives in her own house that she was able to acquire as a result of her work since she saved up for a long time and collaborated with her spouse in the construction of her house.  Her children help her economically since they all work and put everything they can into improving their quality of life.

She does several jobs according to the season.  She sells bananas and on other occasions, fish.  However, her main activity is selling soft-drinks, beer and gelatin desserts at home.  Since she started this activity approximately two years ago she’s worked alone and has been excited to watch how she’s grown to become her customers’ favorite store.  

In the future she wants to have her own stand to sell food items and also wants to build her own beverage distribution center where she can sell all day more comfortably and quickly.  Although she’s attained experience in this line of work she feels that it’s still a little difficult to tend to all the customers she has.  Notwithstanding, she hopes that all the effort she’s put into things will produce good results like up to now.

This is her first MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she’ll feel surer that way of advancing with her work.  She commits to make her payments punctually and she’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 500 soles to buy larger amounts of soft-drinks and beer to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and beer to sell.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
El joven Luis Miguel está soltero, tiene 18 años de edad, cursa el tercer año de educación básica secundaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo gracias apoyo de sus tíos y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora, ya que quiere seguir mejorando sus estudios, y esta computadora le traerá beneficios ya que el próximo años va estar llevando su carrera de educación media, espera seguir mejorando su condición de vida. Quiere que su familia tenga una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 18 years old, he is single and he is attending the third year of secondary school. He engages in weaving, an activity he has started thanks to the support of his aunt and uncle, and today he can count on 4 years of experience.

He has decided to request a loan to buy a computer because he wants to improve in his studies, and he will profit from having a computer as next year he will start attending secondary school, and he hopes to keep on improving his standard of living. He wants his family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories for, and pay for the maintenance of, his tricycle. His earnings assisted with the education of his children and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle and also to buy some equipment to use in his repair shop. His profits from his business will help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eric hopes to buy another tricycle and support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from his studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 50 years old and married with four adult-aged children. She has a farming business. With the business, she usually generates PHP 30,000 per cropping. Lolita has been growing rice for 28 years. Her husband is helping her manage their farm. With farming, they were able to finance their needs and the education of their children as well. Currently, Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase the seedlings and fertilizers needed for her farm. In the future, Lolita hopes to have a large crop of rice.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers needed for her farm

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina. She previously accessed a 21,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of the tricycle unit she and her husband own. Her earnings were a big help toward the education of her children and the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marina is applying for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more spare parts for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marina dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
Lia tiene 52 años, es una mujer que ha trabajado siempre para salir adelante. Hace muchos años que está separada de quien fue su pareja por mucho tiempo. Tiene seis hijos mayores con quienes vive, junto a sus nietos. Su casa la construyeron en un asentamiento humano y su vida no ha sido fácil, pero ella siempre le pone una gota de optimismo a todo lo que hace.

Su trabajo es la venta de golosinas y abarrotes en general, implementó una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde ofrece todo tipo de productos. Atiende todos los días, su pequeña tienda siempre es muy concurrida por ser la único de su barrio en ofrece variedad. Ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma y esa actitud ha hecho que sus vecinos le tengan mucho cariño y sus ventas aumenten. La necesidad de ser independiente y los gastos familiares que a diario tenía que cubrir fueron los motivos principales que le llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo. Lleva ya 5 años en esta actividad, lo hace sola, y al principio sentía que nunca iba a poder tener un negocio en su casa, porque vendía las golosinas de manera ambulatoria por las calles, pero no conseguía vender mucho y se sentía frustrada. Esa situación cambió y ahora se siente más tranquila vendiendo en la bodega que instaló en su casa y que pudo conseguir con muchísimo esfuerzo. Lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse muy temprano para atender. Sin embargo, sabe que eso le traerá buenos resultados económicos al final del día. Le encantaría tener, algún día, una tienda distribuidora de golosinas para vender todos sus productos al por mayor.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y abarrotes para surtir su negocio y seguir vendiendo con fluidez.
texts.en:
Lia, 52, is a woman who has always worked to get ahead.  She’s been separated from her spouse for many years.  She has six adult children that live with her and her grandchildren.  She built her house in a human settlement and her life hasn’t been easy but she always puts a drop of optimism into everything she does.

Her work consists in selling snacks and groceries in general.  She set up a small store at home where she offers all types of products.  She’s open every day and her small store is always busy because it’s the only one in her neighborhood that offers variety.  She’s very well-known for her good humor and charisma and that attitude has led to her neighbors holding her in high esteem and her sales increase as a result.

The need to be independent and to cover daily household expenses were the main reasons that led her to this work.  She’s been in business for five years.  She works by herself and at the beginning felt that she’d never be able to have a business at home because she used to sell snacks as a street vendor from place to place.  She’d get frustrated because she didn’t sell very much that way.

That situation changed and now she feels more tranquil selling in the store she installed at home and was able to get with very much effort.  What she likes best is chatting with her customers and making them laugh.  She feels that the most difficult thing is having to get up very early to start tending to customers.   However, she knows that this will produce good economic results at the end of the day.  She’d love someday to have a snack distributorship to sell all her products at wholesale.

This is her first MFP loan so she thanks those who make it possible for her to continue towards her objectives.  She is very committed to make her payments punctually and responsibly.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are good, kind and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 700 soles to buy larger amounts of snacks and groceries to stock her store and to continue selling smoothly.

loans.use: to buy snacks and sweets to stock her store.

loans.name: Doep

texts.en:
Doep, age 37, operates a hog-raising business as the main source of her family’s income. She raises and sells her mature pigs to a local butcher for slaughter. From this business, she can earn a good income to meet the needs of her family and provide a daily allowance to her school-aged child. She is a widowed woman who has two children, one of whom is already married and lives away from the family while the other one is living with her in a home in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.

In order to sustain her hog-raising business, Doep is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase feed for fattening her pigs. Providing enough food and taking care of her pigs carefully will make them become healthy and mature early. She hopes that she can earn a better income from this investment. She will reinvest her generated income in the business to double the return in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Lors

texts.en:
Lors is a 56-year-old married man and a father of six children who resides in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. He and his wife work in the same type of business, cultivating crops (such as bananas, beans, and sesame) on their farmland. Lors has a lot of work to do on his farm every day, so he works tirelessly at the field from morning until evening to ensure good growth of his crops. From this business, Lors can generate approximately USD 4.00 per day for household use.

Now he would like to take out a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his crops and to pay for labor costs. He believes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his business and make it more viable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his crops and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Tiene un hijo de 4 años que es su principal motor de vida. Vive junto a otros miembros de su familia en la casa propia que obtuvo como herencia de su abuelita y a pesar de algunas carencias siempre tiene una sonrisa para enfrentar la vida. 

Su actividad consiste en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas heladas desde hace más de 2 años. También brinda servicio doméstico en algunas viviendas que requieran su mano de obra en cocina, lavado de prendas o limpieza del hogar. Está muy contenta con ambos trabajos porque puede estar en contacto constante con sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes con lo que a formado una buena relación de negocio. Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por ello que más adelante desea establecer una tienda de abarrotes en el que pueda vender muchos artículos y sus ganancias se multipliquen. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas y gaseosas para continuar vendiendo y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old and is a very happy and hard working woman. She has a four year old child who is the driving force of her life. She lives with other members of her family in her own house that she inherited from her grandmother and despite some needs, she always has a smile to face life.

Her work has consisted of the sale of sodas and cold beers for over two years. She also provides domestic work in some households that require her help in the kitchen, washing garments or cleaning the house. She is very happy with both jobs because she can be in constant contact with her friends, neighbors and some customers with whom she has formed a good business relationship. It is true that her business provides a good income for her. She feels that although it is still not much to cover her main household expenses and it is because of this that she wishes to establish her own grocery store in the future where she would be able to sell more items and her earnings would multiply. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she thanks those who make it possible for her to continue with her goals. On the other hand, she is very committed to making punctual loan payment with a lot of responsibility. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very good, friendly and supportive of each other.

With the amount requested (500 PEN), she will buy a greater quantity of beers and sodas to continue selling and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to continue selling.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is 39 years old and married, living with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a responsible mother of two children who currently are attending school. She and her husband work together to manage their rice-farming business, harvesting twice a year. Aside from this, Ean is busy with taking care of her pigs at home in order to add more income to the family. She raises piglets for slaughter. 

Due to inadequate capital, Ean would like to borrow from Kiva lenders, through HKL, to pay for the operating expenses of cultivating her family's rice crops and to purchase feed for fattening her piglets. She believes that she can increase her yields and income in the following months.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses of cultivating her rice crops and purchase feeds for fattening her piglets.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. The profits from her business will help to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sofia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 32 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two children. 

She has been making creel (baskets) to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $5 per day. 

Sokha is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Acyprian

texts.en: Acyprian is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture sector for seven years. His hardships include unpredictable weather changes. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home for residence and self-education. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business into new markets. Acyprian wants money to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Theresa, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marciano, a carpenter, and a mother to her children.She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Theresa operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also varieties of hanging plants and others. She also grows local banana and pineapple for extra income in her small farm. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community.  She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Theresa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture above) is a construction worker. In addition, he is a rice farmer. Approximately, he earns about $5 per day.  One of her children is employed as garment worker who earns about $2 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Sophan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland and carrying her crops. This purchase will help her reduce the expenses of her farming. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland and carrying her crops

loans.name: Zeca

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pensionista militar, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, janelas, vidros, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e cuidar dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
He's married and has three children who attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a military pensioner. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, window frames, glass, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he wishes to finish building and furnishing his home. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is the high cost of living and taking care of his children.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, window frames, glass, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Tri Yuli

texts.en:
Ibu (Mrs.) Tri is a recent Ruma’s entrepreneur who focuses on becoming one of Loket Ruma agent. Loket Ruma is the new product line that helps our micro entrepreneur become a payment point. She calls herself a true entrepreneur who provides payment services. However, she currently doesn’t own a shop or store. So, customers come directly to her to pay their bill. Ibu Tri is married and has two children, 15 years old and 4 years old.

This EDC machine  will help her to increase her payment business. She hopes people will come to her to actually buy airtime prepaid minutes and also to pay their electricity bill, buy an electricity voucher, and pay their house installment. She believes that this business will eventually add up to more income for her.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Paskari

texts.en: Paskari is a forty-three-year-old married man with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to meet the different tastes and preferences of customers, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are expanding into new markets and moving his business to a more permanent location. Paskari wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been farming for seven years.  She started with one acre, and now she has four. Her hardships are seasonal weather changes, price fluctuation, and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children, and her business goal is buying land to grow more crops.  Scovia is asking for a loan for money to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Saliya

texts.ru:
Салие 54 года, замужем, мать 7 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Салия на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Салии в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы и теленок, 4 коз и 2 лошади, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Салия планирует вложить в оплату обучения младшего сына.
texts.en:
Saliya is 54 years old, she is married and has seven children. She has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation for 35 years as a main source of income for her family, a business which she began with an amount of 6,000 som. Because of her hard work Saliya now has ten sheep, two cows and a calf, four goats and two horses with the sale of milk and dairy products which brings her around 15,000 som (KGS) a month.

Saliya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS with a goal to further grow her business and buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to invest the profit from the loan to pay for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 26-year-old married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has operated a stationery shop for two years. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, high fuel costs, transportation costs, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home, and self education.  His business goal is expanding his business into new markets.  Amon is seeking a loan to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.use: to buy a  photocopying machine

loans.name: Kuluiypa

texts.ru:
Кулуйпе 55 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулуйпа на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулуйпы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  15 овец, 5 коров и теленок, 3 козы и 3 лошади, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 4,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулуйпа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Кулуйпа планирует вложить в ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Kuluiypa is 55 years old, she is a widow and mother of two children. As a main source of income for her family Kuluiypa has been doing animal husbandry for twenty years which she started with an amount of 1,000 som. Because of her hard work Kuluiypa now has fifteen sheep, five cows and a calf, three goats and three horses as well as a sale of milk and dairy products which brings around 4,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Kuluiypa has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to invest the income from the loan into renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Leap is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses and carry the vegetables to sell faster and in larger amounts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
In the photo, Im, who is 47 years old, stands in front of her house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She lives there with her three younger children, while her oldest child is married and lives away. Im is in the business of cultivating rice on the family's inherited farmland.  She tries hard to generate income for her family. Since she became a single parent, she has strived to work harder to provide the basic needs of all her children. Also, some of Im's children help in the business. Recently, two of her children have taken other jobs to help her earn income. Her daughter works as a farm laborer for a local villager, and her son drives a car for a construction company in the province.

As of now, Im is taking out a loan to pay for plowing fees and to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer for her rice crops. This will help her manage her business well, and she hopes she can obtain a good harvest in the following season. In the future, Im wants to expand her farmland and wants to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and purchase a few sacks of fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Lilya is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm where she cultivates land, keeps an orchard of grape trees, and breeds chickens. 

Lilya needs sufficient funds to cultivate the trees and plants on her farm to ensure their stable growth. With the loan's help, Lilya plans to purchase medicine and six bags of fertilizer. This is important for Lilya to gather a rich harvest, from the sales of which she gets the main income for her family. 

Lilya lives in Aghavnadzor village with her husband and three children. She works at the local school as a teacher, but her salary does not allow her to cover the family's costs. Growth of agriculture is important for Lilya to have a stable income and ensure access to education for her children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and six bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan is a widowed woman who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is now 70 years old and has three grown-up children, all of whom are already married. Pan has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to growing crops, from which she can generate income to satisfy her family. She primarily plants rice, in addition to sesame seeds and beans.
