loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 47 years old and is married with two children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 7,000 a month. Robert is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. He grows rice and has been doing it for almost 26 years. In the future, Robert hopes to have a rice crop during harvest in order to earn a higher income to support the needs of his family and to save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla of Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroguieta has been raising pigs for more than 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP per month. She is 56 years old now yet continues to hang on to her piggery livelihood to give adequate life for her 3 children. She became a member of GDMPC in 2008. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing an amount of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feeding supplies. Perla hopes that some day, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Finda from Grassfield in the eastern section of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of 12 and 18 years old.

Finda runs a cosmetics shop within a busy market area. She sells cream, roll on, perfume and pads. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business 12 hours a day and 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

Finda has requested a loan in order to buy more stock of items such as hair cream, baby oil, body cream, roll on, perfume and pad. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to start a savings account. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Finda from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, baby oil, body cream, roll on, perfume and pads.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion is from Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, with 4 children. Asuncion prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been in her business for 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Asuncion joined GDMPC. Asuncion is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make dishes. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make dishes

loans.name: Florsamie

texts.en: Florsamie, married with 2 children, is 25 years old and resides at Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Florsamie owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Florsamie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Florsamie wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia es una señora humilde y muy trabajadora ella reside en Tecpan Guatemala, y gracias a la ayuda de Dios a podido salir adelante con su familila teniendo bajo su responsabilidad a sus hijos,ella se dedica a la siembra de tomates, con su esfuerzo a podido construir un invernadero para la facilidad de la siembra de tomates,tambien se dedica a la siembra de hongos Ostra,que los vende en el mercado, ella en sus timpos libres se dedica a elavorar tejidos tipicos hechos a mano, doña alicia trabaja para apoyar economicamente a su familia ya que para ella es muy inportante para que sus hijos salgan adelante con el esfuerzo de ella,gracias a kiva a podido realizar parte de su sueño ya que a podido agrandar un poco mas su invernadero y desea seguir realizando su sueños.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semilla de tomate,y compra de abono para la siembra de tomates.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is a humble and hardworking woman who lives in Tecpan, Guatemala. Thanks to the help of God, she was able to move her family forward since she is responsible for her children. Alicia grows tomatoes. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to build a greenhouse to make her job easier. She also grows oyster mushrooms that she sells at the market. In her free time, she makes traditional weavings by hand.

Doña Alicia works to support her family financially because she believes it is very important for her children to get ahead as a result of her efforts. Thanks to Kiva, she will be able to accomplish part of her dream. She will be able to slightly expand her greenhouse so that she can continue to fulfill her dreams.

Alicia is requesting this loan so that she can buy tomato seeds and compost for growing tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and compost.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is married with 3 kids. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marina operates a fishing business for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earns 6,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair her fishing boat. Marina has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Marina hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Elgena

texts.en: Elgena is married with a child. She is 32 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elgena owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for services to increase her crop yield. Elgena has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, her plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy jovial, alegre y trabajadora. Está casada hace 14 años con Carlos, de 61 años, con quien tuvo un solo hijo, que ya es mayor y ha formado su propia familia. Ahora vive en la casa que construyó su esposo, ahí comparten su día a día y el deseo de envejecer viviendo dignamente.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza (detergentes, blanqueadores, jabones, etc.). Su venta es a pedido y la entrega lo hace llevando su mercadería hasta la casa del cliente. La cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 16 años y desde que se inició siempre a trabajado sola. Algunas veces también complementa sus ventas con productos como cosméticos y abarrotes. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya puede disponer de su tiempo libre.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) comprará mayor cantidad de productos de limpieza y algunos abarrotes para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Lidia, 57, is a jovial, cheerful and hardworking woman.  She has been married to Carlos, 61, for 14 years, and together they have a son who is grown and has his own family.  She now lives in a house that her husband built where they share their daily life, and this is where they want to grow old together in dignity.

Lidia has a business selling cleaning products (detergents, bleaches, soaps, etc.)  She sells on the basis of orders, delivers the merchandise to the customer's home, and collects daily.  She has been doing this type of work for 16 years, and ever since she started the business she has worked on her own.  Sometimes she supplements her sales by also selling products such as cosmetics and groceries.  She really likes what she does, because it allows her to have some free time.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she appreciates the opportunity and the trust that is being placed in her.  In addition, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner.  She appreciates being part of her communal bank, because she has seen that the members are responsible and cooperative people.  

With the sum of 800 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy a large quantity of cleaning products and some groceries to increase the variety of products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products and groceries to sell

loans.name: Leodila

texts.es:
Leodila tiene 47 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 27 años es Riter, de 42 años, fruto de su amor tienen dos hijos, de 16 y 20 años. Hace 3 años pudo obtener su casa propia, comprándola con el dinero que junto con su pareja durante años, pues anteriormente vivían en una casa alquilada.

Su negocio es el servicio de transporte fluvial trasladando personas o mercadería a los centros poblados asentados en la ribera de los ríos. Hace contratos con los comerciantes que transportarán sus productos hacia esos lugares y en el caso del traslado de personas, solo tiene que colocar un aviso sobre su horario y recorrido. Trabaja durante 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, en todo este tiempo a podido obtener tres botes grandes y desea tener una flota de 10. Realiza su trabajo con la ayuda de su conyugue y sus hijos, juntos realizan los viajes por todos los ríos de su región. Adicionalmente, lleva algunos comestibles, ropa y licores que ofrece en cada pueblo donde desembarcan sus pasajeros. Durante el tiempo que lleva en esta actividad aprendió a conocer las necesidades de los pobladores de las zonas que visita y eso le ha ayudado a determinar la cantidad y la frecuencia con la que debe realizar sus viajes.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir, licores y víveres en general para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Leodila is 47, and is a good woman: friendly and very hard-working. Her partner Riter is 42, and they have been together for 27 years. They have two children, ages 16 and 20.  She was able to buy her own house three years ago, buying it with the money she and her partner saved up over years, as previously they lived in a rented house.

Her business is river transportation, carrying people or merchandise to the populated centers located on the banks of the rivers. She contracts with the merchants who will ship their products to those places, and in the case of transporting people, she only has to post a notice about her schedule and route. 

She has been working for eight years in this business and it is going well. Over all this time, she has been able to obtain three large boats, and wishes to have a fleet of ten. 

She carries on her work with the help of her partner and her children. Together they make journeys throughout the rivers in their region. 

In addition she carries some foodstuffs, clothing and alcoholic beverages that she sells in each town where they disembark their passengers. During the time she has been in this business, she has learned to know the needs of the villagers in the areas she visits, and that has helped her to determine quantities, as well as the frequency with which she must undertake her trips. 

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has a loan, as this way she will feel more certain of going forward with her work. As well, she promises, once again, to make her installment payments on time, as she did previously. 

In addition, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all its members are very responsible and supportive. 

With the amount of 1,500 soles applied for, she will buy a greater quantity of merchandise, consisting of clothing articles, alcoholic beverages and supplies in general, in order to continue selling.

loans.use: To buy groceries, clothing and other items to take to sell along the banks of the rivers.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya runs a little shop, where she sells flowers and cases for mobile phones. In order to be more competitive and increase sales Amalya would like to increase the variety of flowers. She has applied for this loan to purchase more flowers for her shop. 

Amalya started her business a few years ago to have a stable source of income for her family. She lives together with her daughter. This loan will help her to increase the business income and invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for flowers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, single, is 47 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating an extra income of 10,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 5 years. Marilyn requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Marilyn is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Marilyn wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is an entrepreneur from Yerevan. He runs a business of making and selling keys. To improve the quality of the keys and make the working process more effective, Misha wants to purchase a new machine for making keys. This will allow him to increase the number of keys he makes and provide a better quality of service for his clients. 

Misha lives with his wife and two daughters. He started the business in 2003. Development of the business is important for Misha to have more income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a machine for making keys

loans.name: Fabricio Alfredo

texts.es: Fabricio vive en las Orquídeas con sus padres. Tiene 25 años y se dedica a la cerrajería. Aprendió desde muy joven la actividad ya que su papa se dedica a este labor y poco a poco le fue enseñando como cortar y moldear el aluminio. Como es soltero trabaja con él en su taller sin horario fijo ya que es su ayudante. Da gracias a Dios por que el negocio es rentable y tiene clientela ya que las construcciones van en aumento. Fabricio solicita el crédito para poder hacerse socio en el negocio de su padre comprando aluminio que es la materia prima. Su meta a futuro es independizarse para forma su familia y darle un bienestar estable.
texts.en:
Fabricio lives in Orquídeas with his parents. He is 25 years old and manages a metal shop. At a very young age, Fabricio learned this trade from his father who is in the same line of work. Gradually he learned how to cut and mold aluminum. As a single man, he works in his father’s shop as his assistant and without a set schedule. Thanks to God, the business is profitable and has a customer base due to the increase in construction.

Fabricio is requesting a loan so that he can become a partner in his father’s business. He will buy aluminum, since it is the raw material that they use. His goals for the future include becoming independent, starting a family, and providing them with stability and well-being.

loans.use: to buy aluminum.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is from Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Tessie is married and has 6 grown children. To make a living, Tessie cultivates fruits and coconuts. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Tessie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is 48 years old and widowed. She was left alone to take care of six children. 

Now, two of them are studying in university, putting more financial responsibilities on her. She wants to see all of her children get their bachelor's degree and start working.

Kawthar has applied for this loan to help her pay her children's registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Namungoona Women's Group

texts.en:
Women in the market decided to form a group such that they could improve their livelihoods and those of their families.

Aidah, a member, is a 39-year-old divorcee with 4 children aged between 12 and 20 years. She sells silver fish in the outskirts of Kampala. She started the business in 2007 so that she could get school fees for her children. She has been able to take her children to school and expanded her business as well.

Her dream is to see all her children through school and start selling fish on a large scale.

She is affected by the rising cost of living in the city, coupled with the many family demands that she meets single handedly. Aidah is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children and buy fish to sell

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is a 43-year-old married woman who is responsible for six children: three married children and three single children. She and her husband earn a living by cultivating rice in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been in this business for almost thirty years, earning approximately 6.00 USD per day, which she uses for her daily food needs, clothing, and allowances for her children. To help the family, two of her children decided to work as sewing staff in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

Currently, Khim does not own any animals for her farm work, so she is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a couple of cows which she will use to manage her farm work. Also, the animals will help Khim cut down on her plowing fee expenses every harvesting season. In the future, Khim hopes to make improvements in her business, expand her farmland, and increase her yield and income.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mariama from Grassfield in the eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 22 years old. One of her children is a university student and two are currently attending school. Some six years ago, Mariama established her local foodstuff business. She sells beans, groundnuts, rice, and oranges. She began her business because she was a petty trader and now she wants to improve her business skills and standard of living. She works at her business every day of the month. She says that the main challenges to her business are weather conditions, food shortages, and price fluctuation.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more local foodstuff such as beans, groundnuts, rice, and oranges. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Mariama plans to expand and grow her business. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mariama from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuff such as beans, groundnuts, rice, and oranges.

loans.name: Shaaban

texts.en:
Shaaban is a 39-year-old married man. He is a father of five children.

Shaaban is a butcher who has his own butcher shop and a small fruit and vegetable shop, located in the middle of the market.

Now, Shaaban wants to rent the shop next door in order to expand his business. He has applied for a loan for this reason.

loans.use: to rent the shop next door.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Regina from Grassfield in the eastern area of Freetown. She is divorced with two children between the ages of 12 and 14 years old. Her children are currently attending school. In 2004, Regina established her provision store business. She began her business after her husband divorced her for another woman. She started a business to generate a permanent income to send her children to school. She works at the business every day from morning until night seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are the poor road network and low purchase power during the rainy season.

Regina requires a loan in order to buy more food commodities such as coffee cream, mayonnaise, marmite and butter. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and educate her children up to university since she is a single parent. In the future, Regina plans to establish another enterprise. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Regina from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more food such as coffee cream, mayonnaise, marmite and butter

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Isatu from Grassfield in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. Her children are currently attending. 

Isatu runs a general merchandise store within a busy market area. She sells bags of rice, rubber bowls, oil, lining materials, and slippers. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:30 pm seven days per week. She also earns income from transportation of a commercial bike. At present, she is facing low purchasing power of her customers during the rainy season.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more stock of items such as bags of rice, rubber bowls, oil, lining materials, and slippers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she plans to own a structure for her family. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Isatu from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, rubber bowls, oil, lining materials, and slippers.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Zainab from Grassfield in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 12 and 18 years old.  Her children attend school. Her husband works in security but his income is not enough to support the home. She began this business because she wants to generate income to support her family. She was a student at a vocational training school doing Gara dyeing.   

Zainab runs a provision shop where she sells sugar, bread, cheese, custard, milk, and Quaker oats. She has been running this business for seven years. She works at the business seven days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. Her major problem is transportation costs from town to her business place. 

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy similar items in her shop such as sugar, bread, cheese, custard, milk, and Quaker oats. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and start up a savings account. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Zainab from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar, bread, cheese, custard, milk, and Quaker oats

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is from the village of Pines. She is 45 years old. Edith is married and has three children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. Edith has been in her business for seven years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Edith joined GDMPC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a 24-year-old single woman. She has four siblings. Rawan is a university student majoring in Business Administration. She is in her third year. She has applied for this loan to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amiemaud

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Amiemaud from Waterloo, a rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of two and 18 years old. She has two additional dependents that live with her at home.  

Amiemaud runs a pharmacy store. She sells blood syrup, malarial drugs, baby oil, pads, and cool tablets. She has been running this business for seven years. She began this business because there was no medical center available in the community. She works at the business 15 hours a day, seven days per week. She also earns income from the patients she usually treats at home. She says that the main challenges to her business are the electricity supply to the store and transportation.

Amiemaud has requested a loan through BRAC in order to buy more medical drugs such as blood syrup, malarial drugs, baby oil and pads. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to build a community hospital. She appreciates your support. 


*Please note this loan's original disbursement date was 6/15/12. Due to a generator failure, which prevented upload, this loan was post-dated.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Amiemaud from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more medical drugs such as blood syrup, malarial drugs, baby oil and pads.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Estanislado, quien es comerciante y el padre de su único hijo, Josué de 10 años. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años.  

Su negocio es la venta de madera, la cual compra de un aserradero y la transporta en su propia furgoneta, ahorrándose los gastos de transporte y para la entrega de la madera vendida. Esta actividad lo realiza desde su vivienda, junto a su esposo y una persona que les ayuda, siendo sus principales clientes los carpinteros de su localidad. Se inicio hace más de 3 años con un capital propio, primero comprando en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue aumentando viendo la demanda. Antes de empezar con su negocio tenía dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de su hijo y ella tiene el deseo de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación. 

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con este apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal, apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de madera en mayor cantidad para tener disponible para la venta, ya que los precios están subiendo.
texts.en:
Emiliana, age 48, is a hardworking woman who has plenty of drive to succeed. She is married to Estanislado, who is a merchant and the father of their only child, 10-year-old Josué. They live in their own home that they purchased after many years of saving.

Her business involves selling wood. She buys her inventory from a sawmill and transports it using a van that she owns. This enables her to save the shipping costs that would have been charged if she were to have the wood delivered. Emiliana operates her business out of her home, along with her husband and one other person who helps them. Her main customers are carpenters from the area. She started this business more than three years ago using her own capital. Emiliana bought a small quantity of wood and purchased more when she saw the demand increase. Prior to starting her business, she was facing financial difficulties. Her expenses increased after she had her son. She wants to provide him with a better quality of life and a good education.

This is her 14th loan with the MFP organization, which will give her the support she needs to continue meeting her goals. Emiliana enjoys working with her Communal Bank because the members help one another with advancing their businesses. The amount of 3,500 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of a large quantity of wood so that she will have available inventory to sell since prices are increasing.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Los Centeno Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Centeno lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Heyling quien tiene un taller de costura en la cual realiza especialmente delantales y gabachas. La meta de ella es mejorar su hogar y adquirir una moto.
Las otras integrantes son Martha se dedica a la venta de gaseosa y productos lácteos desde hace 8 años y Trinidad quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The group “Los Centeno” consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Heyling, who has a sewing workshop where she specializes in producing aprons and smocks. Her goals are to improve her home and acquire a motorcycle.

The other members are as follows: • Martha has been selling sodas and dairy products for eight years. • Trinidad has been selling fruits and vegetables for one year.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, crochet supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely of Biasong, Lopez Jaena, helps her family by means of a pot-making business. She is 50 years old and single, and tries her best to earn a living on her own. She has managed this business for four years and earns about 4,500 PHP per month. For the time being, she needs to buy more clay to use in  her business. 

Mely joined GDMPC in 2011. She thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 5,000 PHP with which they provide her. Mely desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to use in her pot-making business.

loans.name: Marisyl

texts.en:
Marisyl, 25, is a resident of Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She provides for the needs of her two children with the small amount of 5,000 PHP she earns monthly from her own piggery business. She has run this business for three years as an aid to the income earned by her husband. 

In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC and she has now applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC Microfinance to buy feeding supplies. Marisyl wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 32, is a married woman who lives with her husband and two school-age children in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She cultivates primarily rice on her farmland to earn her livelihood. In addition, she devotes time to raising pigs at home for additional income.

Lim is happy because she has a supportive husband who helps her manage most of the maintenance of the rice field. Together, they agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they can earn degrees and become professionals someday. Lim believes that education is one of the most important tools to alleviate poverty.

As of now, Lim is taking out a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase timbers and construction supplies to repair and expand her house. She hopes to receive the loan from lenders to improve her family’s living condition. In the coming years, Lim plans to save money to purchase an extra plot of farmland to increase her rice output.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and construction supplies to repair and expand her house.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
For over three years in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Liza, a 43-year-old married mother of two, has made a living operating a retail store. She sells a variety of food and home-use products, earning 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 30, is married and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and, in addition, is a rice farmer. He also earns approximately $3 per day.

Touch is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to run an additional business fattening animals and to help her children earn Bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Timas

texts.en:
Timas, 29, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fertilizer for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is an arc welder who earns about $4 each day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Timas is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more fertilizer for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for resale.

loans.name: Sakim

texts.en:
Sakim is 49 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making thatch out of palm leaves for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. 

Her husband is a rice farmer. In addition, he is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sakim is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more palm leaves to make more thatch to sell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children gain higher education.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves to make more thatch to sell.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is a twenty-two year old woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent home. 

Kellen has been operating a retail shop for the last two years and her main hardship is inadequate capital to buy enough stock. She needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

Her vision is to expand her business into new markets and to buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 44-year-old divorced man with one child and 2 dependents. He has been selling milk since 2010 so that he can earn income to meet his family needs. He operates the business in the outskirts of the city where there is demand for milk. He works every day of the week to satisfy the needs of his customers. 

Laban wants the money to buy another cooler because the one he has at the moment is not big enough to store enough milk. He hopes to open more dairy shops and also to start a mobile money point. Through loans acquired from Ugafode, he has been able to expand the business from keeping milk in jerrycans to the current status, storing it in coolers. Laban is hard-working and creative.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 44 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable. Tiene un niño de 2 años, a quien cría brindándole mucho amor y protección. Vive en su casa propia, a lado de sus dos hermanas, a quienes brinda acogida en su hogar.

Su trabajo es la confección de ropa. Tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo hace 15 años. Todo lo que sabe lo aprendió trabajando desde joven como empleada de una señora que se dedicaba a este oficio, poco a poco y con mucha paciencia fue conociendo sobre las técnicas de costura y decidió independizarse para generar sus propios ingresos. Durante el tiempo que está dedicada a esta actividad siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su trabajo, ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes la ha llevado a creer que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente su labor; sin embargo le hizo frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio. Ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos, ya que tiene pedidos pendientes.

Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores ocasiones. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) implementará su taller de costura, comprando telas, agujas, hilos y otros accesorios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old.  She is a nice and very responsible woman.  She has a 2-year-old boy who she is raising, offering him a lot of love and protection.  She lives in her own house alongside her two sisters who she has welcomed in her home.

Mary's business is making clothes.  She has a workshop in her home and has been in this line of work for 15 years.  She learned everything she knows from working since she was young for a lady who was in this business.  Gradually, and with a lot of patience, she learned sewing techniques and decided to start working for herself in order to make her own income.  Over the years that she has been in this business, she has always looked for the best way of doing her work because sometimes the pressure from her customers has made her believe that she will not be able to finish her work efficiently.  However, she has faced her problems and now she has plans to expand her business.  She is currently getting ready to start making her own designs and selling them as she has orders pending.

This is Mary's third loan from MFP and she is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Mary is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members are very nice, friendly and supportive of each other.

Mary will use the 800 soles she has requested to equip her sewing workshop, buying fabric, threads, needles and other supplies that she needs to continue doing her work.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 35 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es German, de 37 años, con quien tiene dos hijos; Gabriela de 15 y Angélica de 4 años. Vive desde hace muchos años en la casa de los padres de su pareja, con quienes tiene una buena relación de armonía y respeto.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos cosméticos, ropa y zapatos u otros artículos de acuerdo a la temporada. A diario sale en busca de sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son amigos, vecinos y familiares, lleva realizando este trabajo por 14 años y siempre lo ha hecho sola. Cuando empezó no le fue muy bien porque solamente esperaba que los clientes lleguen a su casa en busca de sus productos, eso no le funcionaba porque no vendía la cantidad que quería, pero con el tiempo aprendió que para tener éxito en este tipo de trabajo tiene que salir en busca de los clientes y tener técnicas de convencimiento para poder vender lo suficiente. 

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará más mercadería; ropa y algunos cosméticos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
35-year-old Tania is a nice, friendly, very hard-working woman.  Her partner is 37-year-old German.  The couple have two children: 15-year-old Gabriela and 4-year-old Angélica.  Tania has lived with her partner's parents for many years.  They have a good relationship which is both harmonious and respectful.

Tania's business is selling cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other items according to the season.  Every day, she goes out in search of her customers who are mainly friends, neighbors and family members.  She has been in this line of work for 14 years and has always worked alone.  When she first started out things didn't go very well  because she would wait for her customers to come to her house to buy her products.  This did not work.  She did not sell the quantity of goods that she would have liked to.  However, over time she learned that in order to be successful in this type of work, if you want to sell enough, you have to go out and find customers and be convincing in your sales pitch.

This is Tania's seventh loan from MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity and the trust that is being placed in her.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Tania enjoys being a member of her community bank because its members are responsible and supportive people.

Tania will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy more merchandise: clothing and some cosmetics that she needs in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a fifty-six year old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a civil servant for six years and with the salary he has earned, he has been able to buy land and start construction of his residential house.

His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house while his business goal is to start up a piggery project. 

Emmy wants money to complete the building of his house and to pay school fees.

loans.use: to complete the building of his residential house and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles to install in her home

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a thirty-nine-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been an assistant education officer for two years. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and upgrading his studies.

James intends to use the money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Las Orquidias Group

texts.es: Mildren tiene 29 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Orquidias, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es taxista, ellos residen en la Colonia Los Dardanelos de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Mildren inicio vendiendo charamuscas y ropa, desde hace trece años y cuando empezó a tener mas clientela decidió solicitar un préstamo para poner una pequeña chiclera luego su negocio fue creciendo y se dispuso a establecer una pulpería, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am y culmina a las 10:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hijas que es quien le administra el negocio. Mildren esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, arroz, azúcar, leche, dulces, leña, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella podrá surtir su negocio con los productos que le demandan sus clientes. Su meta es poder establecer un supermercado en su hogar y su sueño es que su negocio crezca para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y estudiantiles de sus hijos. Es el primer financiamiento que solicita Mildren en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Mildren is 29 years old, married and has three children.  She is a member of the 'Las Orquidias' solidarity group.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  The family live in Los Dardanelos, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Mildren started out in business thirteen years ago, selling candy twists and clothing.  As she started gaining more customers, she decided to apply for a loan so that she could set up a small street stall selling candies.  Her business continued to grow and she set up a grocery store.  Her work hours are from 5.00am to 10.00pm.  She works together with one of her daughters who runs the business.

Mildren is requesting this loan to invest in buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, milk, candies, firewood, etc.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her business with the products her customers are asking for.  Her goal is to set up a supermarket in her home and her dream is for her business to grow so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and their children's school expenses.  This is the first loan that Mildren has requested from FAMA and she expects to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy groceries and firewood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-one-year-old single mother with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for twenty-one years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goals are diversifying her business and expanding the business to new markets.

Mary intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 29-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He runs a shop, where he trades glasses, wallets and accessories. Davit has been running this business for four years. Now he wants to add more inventory to his shop to increase the sales. 

With the loan's help Davit plans to purchase glasses and wallets. This is important for Davit to meet the demand of his clients and stay competitive in the market. 

Davit lives with his parents, wife and little child. Development of the business will allow Davit to earn more income and provide more prosperous conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for glasses and wallets.

loans.name: Wildrace

texts.en:
Wildrace is a thirty-one-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for eight years. Her hardships are high taxes, high fuel and transportation costs which leaves her with almost no savings. Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent home and saving for the wedding. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, moving her business to more permanent location and becoming a money lender.

Widrace wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en:
Jockus is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for two years. He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets. 

Jockus wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr: Therese est une femme de 43 ans, mere de trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 18 ans. Ses trois enfants vont actuellement a l'ecole. Therese a une alimentation (petit commerce general)dans laquelle elle commercialise le necessaire pour le petit déjeuné de ses voisin, les friandises, et les petits produits de première necessité pres de son domicile qu'elle gere depuis 17 mois deja. Elle a aquise et fidelise une clientele grace a sa bonne experience dans ce domaine de commercialisation de produit de consommation courante. Elle solicite ce credit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise(palettes d'eau minérale, cartons de savon, huile), afin de satisfaire sa clientele de plus en plus grandissante. Ceci lui permettra d'augmenter ses benefices qui l'aideront a grandir son activite en achetant plus de produits et en subvenant a ces besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Therese is a 43-year-old woman.  She has three children, ages 8 to 18, who currently attend school.

For the past 17 months already, she has been managing a small grocery store, where she sells items her neighbors need for breakfast, candy and other essential items, near her house.  Thanks to a good experience in this field of business (small retail), she has attracted a loyal group of customers.

She is requesting this loan to boost her stock of merchandise (several pallets of mineral water, cartons of soap and cans of oil) in order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers.

With more products to sell, she will be able to increase her profits, expand her business, and take care of her needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy several pallets of mineral water, cartons of soap and cans of oil

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Mme Fatou âgée de 56 ans mariée et mère de famille habite dans la ville principale, couturière de profession elle fait de la teinture et de la création depuis plus de 20 ans.
Mme Fatou sollicite un crédit de 500 000 pour acheter des tissus pour la confection de prêts à porter qu’elle va vendre après .Mme Fatou a pour projet future d’accroitre ses revenus afin d’augmenter sa production.
texts.en: Fatou is 56 years old, married and lives in a major city in Senegal with her family. She is a professional seamstress, having dyed and sewed clothing for more than 20 years. Mrs Fatou is asking for a loan of 500,000 in order to purchase cloth which she will turn into ready-made clothing to sell. She wants to use the increased revenue to augment her level of production.

loans.use: purchase cloth to be prepared for sales

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une jeune femme célibataire de 24 ans avec un enfant âgé de 09ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et divers. Elle effectue ses activités au grand marché et est confrontée très souvent au problème d’inflation sur le marché. Il devient donc important pour elle de disposer d’un stock suffisant de marchandises. Ayoko effectue ses opérations financières avec WAGES et  sollicite un crédit en vue de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle espère qu’avec ce crédit elle pourra assurer la croissance de son étalage et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Ayoko is a single 24 year old woman and the mother of a 9 year old child. She works as a seller of food productions and other general store items. She sells these products at the largest market and is often confronted with problems related to inflation. It is thus becoming increasingly important for her to stock up on a large quantity of merchandise. WAGES is Ayoko's financial bank and she is asking for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise. She hopes that this loan will also enable her to ensure the growth of the number of products she has to sell and lead to a having a happy household.

loans.use: Acheter des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte à un lavage auto depuis 07 mois. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont le plus grand à 13ans et le plus petit à 07 ans. Elle à 04 enfants à charge et veut s'acheter du matériel à lavage auto afin de maximiser les revenues de son lavage auto. Elle a 04 enfants scolarisés et avec ses économies,Mme compte assurer tout au moins 02 repas journaliers à ses enfants. Elle ambitionne aussi de continuer à les scolariser jusqu'a l'université.
texts.en: Brigitte has owned a car wash for 7 months. She is married, the mother of four children aged between 13 years and 7 years, and lives in Benin. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials needed for her car wash (a water compresserm 50 meters of electrical wire and 20 liters of liquid soap) in order to maximize her profits. All four of her children attend school and she hopes to use her profits to ensure they have at least two meals a day. She hopes to keep them in school until they are ready to enter a University.

loans.use: purchase 1 water compresser, 50 meters of electrical wire and 20 liters of liquid soap

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene 34 años de edad, es casada  y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de servicio de seguridad, ellos residen en la Colonia Sosa Lobo, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Marilú inicio vendiendo baleadas en su casa, luego decidió poner el negocio de venta de golosinas, su  horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm, su ventaja es que tiene mucha clientela y el único problema que enfrenta es porque tiene que pagar renta por el local. Marilú esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una refrigeradora ya que la necesita para poder vender refrescos y agua en su negocio para así ofrecerles mas variedad a sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir sus gastos. Su meta es lograr tener su propio local y así dejar de pagar alquiler, su sueño es poder hacer su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Marilú is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a security company and they live in the Sosa Lobo neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. Marilú started selling baleadas [ a Honduran delicacy] from her house. Later she decided to start selling candies and snacks. Her daily schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The advantage is that she has a lot of customers and the only problem she faces is paying the rent for the locale. Marilú is asking for the loan to invst in buying a refrigerator since she needs to be able to sell beverages and water at her business for her customers to have more variety. With the support of this loan, she will be able to get the attention of more customers and continue having an economic activity that will allow her to cover her expenses. Her goal is to have her own locale and thus stop paying rent. Her dream is to build her bouse and help her children to become professionals. This is her first cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Juliana tiene un puesto en el mercado de su zona, allí vende productos de abarrotes. Esto es azúcar, arroz, fideos y toda clase de menestras. tiene cerca de 05 años trabajando y  le va muy bien, su clientela siempre acude a su negocio en busca de buenos precios, el negocio está ubicado en su misma casa y junto a su esposo comparten labores él se dedica a repartir los productos a diferentes bodegas, mercados y restaurantes y ella atiende a los compradores que acuden a su tienda,  gracias a su trabajo han logrado terminar la construcción de su casa, también han adquirido 2 moto taxis que dan en alquiler lo cual le genera otras ganancias, lo que más desea la Sra. Juliana es comprarse un puesto de venta en algún mercado para poner otra sucursal de su negocio, su préstamo le servirá para seguir incrementando su tienda con la compra de mas productos. Juliana es socia del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO”  ya tiene varios años trabajando junto a sus compañeras de grupo.

*Juliana viste chaleco azul y polo naranja.
texts.en:
Juliana has a spot in the area market where she sells grocery items. These are sugar, rice, pasta and all types of vegetable stews. She has been doing this work for close to 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her customers always go to her business seeking good prices. The business is located in her house and she divides the work between her and her husband. He delivers products to different stores, markets and restaurants and she attends to customers who go to her store. Thanks to their work, they have been able to finish construction on their home. They have also acquired 2 motorcycle taxis that they rent out to generate more income. What Juliana wants the most is to buy a sales spot in some market to open up another branch of her business. Her loan will be used to keep growing her store by buying more products. Juliana is a member of the “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO” group and has been working with the members for several years.

*Juliana is wearing a blue vest and an orange shirt.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty wants to buy a plot of land. She is single mother living in Masindi, Uganda and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. She has a bar. She began as a bar attendant in someone’s bar and after saving her wages she rented a room and started her own bar. Theft and seasonal weather hinders her business. 

She desires to build a permanent home and to buy land and grow crops.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in brick-making for two years and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children up to university level.

Justine wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives in Metsamor town with her family, including her parents, brother, sister-in-law and little cousin. About two years ago Hranush's family started their own business by renting a shop and starting a business, where they sell cosmetics, accessories and household goods. 

Hranush has applied for this loan to purchase a larger variety of inventory for the shop. This will allow Hranush to earn more income from the business, which is vital for her family to meet their needs. 

Hranush and her family plan to start their own shop without renting a premise. Additional income will allow her to fulfill this purpose.

loans.use: to pay for inventory for the shop

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a 27-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been knitting sweaters for five years. She started her business with 50,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchases stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Evelyne's personal goals are to educate children and herself. Her business goals are to hire employees to help expand her business, move her business to a more permanent location and expand her business into new markets. Evelyne is requesting a loan to buy spools of thread for knitting sweaters.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Affoussa Evelyne

texts.fr: Affoussa Evelynen est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des pagnes et des bazins depuis des années ans et deux de ses enfants  vont à l'école. Affoussa Evelyne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ses clients sont des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Elle veut acheter des tissus, des pagnes et des bazins. Affoussa Evelyne avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne garantir des soins médicaux adéquats pour ses enfants et aider son mari à construire leur maison.
texts.en: Affoussa Evelynen is married and the mother of three children aged between 10 years and 3 years old, 2 of whom attend school. She has been selling cloths, pagnes and bazins (both traditional articles of clothing in Benin) for several years. She stocks up in a market in Benin and her customers live in the neighborhoods surrounding her home. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise. She wants to use her profits to help her children attend school and save the remaining funds. She hopes to some day be able to purchase adequate medicines for her children when needed and support her husband in the building of their home.

loans.use: purchase two rolls of cloth, 30 page (traditional loincloths) and 8 bazins (another traditional article of clothing)

loans.name: Bisogho

texts.en:
Bisogho is a 30-year-old, married woman with three children. She and her family live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel/restaurant business for five years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. 

Bisogho's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. Her business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops and to expand her business into new markets. Bisogho is requesting a loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 43-year-old, married man with four children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the firewood business for two and a half years. His hardships are high taxes, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. 

Alfred's personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops and to expand his business to new markets. Alfred is requesting a loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David wants a loan to buy general merchadise such as sugar and cooking oil to sell. He is a twenty-four-year-old harworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. For three years he has been operating a retail shop and with the proceeds he has been able to have all the basics.

He desires to educate himself and expand his business into new markets, despite challenges including inadequate capital to invest in the business.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ando

texts.en:
Ando is involved in agriculture. He cultivates land and raises cattle. Ando has been involved in this business for many years and has created all the necessary conditions with which to develop his farm. 

Ando plans to purchase cows, which will allow him to earn more income from the sales of agricultural products. Ando plans to build a new barn and continue increasing the number of his cattle. The addiitional income from the use of this loan will give him an opportunity to implement these goals. 

Ando lives with his wife, three children and parents. Agriculture is the main source of income for the entire family, so Ando is determined to develop his business in order to cover the family's cost of living.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a forty-seven-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years. He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goals are expanding business into new markets and diversifying his business to include farming.

Josephat wants money to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks and salt to sell.

loans.name: Agabus

texts.en:
Agabus is a fifty-three-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling firewood for two years. He started with 70,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardships are high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home and cultivating land for crops. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets.

Agabus wants the money to buy trees for firewood.

loans.use: to buy trees for firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson is a 36-year-old, married man with three children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a civil servant for three years. During this time in service he has been able to buy land where he intends to build his residential house.

Neckson's personal goals are to build a permanent home and educate his children up to the university level. Neckson requests a loan to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker and he has been in banking for two years. His personal goal is educating his child up to university level and also upgrading his own studies.

Robert intends to use the money to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself..

loans.name: Misuless

texts.en:
Misuless is a thirty-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a bar business for one year. Her hardship is inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is hiring employees to help expand the business.

Misuless wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband she runs a farm, where they cultivate land and raise livestock. In order to increase the number of cattle, Lida has applied for this loan. 

With the requested amount she plans to purchase four young cattle. This will allow Lida to breed the cattle and continue increasing their number. Lida hopes to produce more agricltural products, from the sales of which her family gets its income. 

Lida currently lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and little grandchild.

loans.use: to pay for four young cattle.

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Paulina de 53 años tiene 03 hijos es casada y  su esposo trabaja como tornero, ella tiene un  negocio de venta de comidas cuando empezó solo tenía una carreta pequeña con la que se movilizaba por diferentes zonas, después de un tiempo logro comprarse un triciclo más grande, una vitrina y algunas banquitas. el negocio lo instalo en la puerta de su casa, allí prepara variados potajes como picarones, cachangas y yuquitas los que ofrece a los consumidores que acuden al lugar, gracias a su trabajo es que ha podido pagar los estudios de una de sus hijas, para más adelante quiere buscar un lugar más grande donde poner su negocio esta vez usara su préstamo para comprar utensilios de cocina y algunas ollas deterioradas, la alcancía que integra es “SOLIDARIDAD”  donde es socia cerca de 5 años.
*Paulina aparece en la foto sentada y viste chompa negra y blusa blanca
texts.en: Paulina is 53 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a lathe operator and she has a food business. When she started out, she only had a small cart which she wheeled through different neighborhoods. After a while, she managed to buy a larger, three-wheeled cart, a display case and some benches, and set up her business just outside her house. There she prepares a variety of different foods such as picarones, 'cachangas' (a bread-like fried dough) and 'yuquitas' (yucca fries) which she sells to customers. Thanks to this work, she has been able to pay for one of her daughter's studies. However, in the future, she would like to find larger premises where she can set up her business. On this occasion, Paulina will use her loan to buy cooking utensils and some new pans as the ones she currently uses are worn. Paulina's community bank is called 'Solidaridad' (Solidarity). She has been a member for five years. * In the photo, Paulina is sitting down wearing a black sweater and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and pans

loans.name: Jivan

texts.en:
Jivan runs a shop selling electronic goods. He has a large variety of electronic and computer devices and accessories. Jivan would like to add new models of devices in his shop, which is why he has applied for this loan. 

With the requested amount he plans to purchase new models of TV sets. This will allow Jivan to have an advantage in the market. 

Jivan lives with his wife and three children. Being the main breadwinner in the family, Jivan sees it as important that he is able to expand and develop his business so he can earn more income and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase TV sets.

loans.name: Fayiah T.

texts.en:
Fayiah T. is 40 years old and lives in Compound#3 with his wife and children. His children, who are aged between six and sixteen, are in school. Fayiah stopped his education when he was in 12th grade. 

Since 2009, he has been running a shop where he sells artificial hair and other items. He started this business with help from his brother. One of the problems he faces is transporting the goods to his shop.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair and other items for his business. He likes the way his business keeps him busy. His plan is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair and other items for his business.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina  tiene 49 años es docente de profesión. Ella tiene una librería a la que le ha puesto el nombre de su hijo “LIBRERÍA ALEXIS”  su  negocio  ya tiene cerca de 20 años, fue  gracias  a su hermano que ella aprendió todo sobre ese negocio  actualmente tiene 2 tiendas una en su casa y otra en una universidad, gracias a los prestamos de EDAPROSPO pudo abrir su segunda tienda esto le ha permitido seguir creciendo y lograr muchas cosas  lo más importante es haberle brindado a su hijo buenos estudios ,construir su casa y terminar su profesión con una maestría. todos sus logros son fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo arduo. La Sra. Justina es miembro de la alcancía “FUTURO PARA EL BIEN” con su préstamo actual podrá seguir invirtiendo en útiles escolares, con el fin de tener bien surtido su negocio para ofrecer variedad de artículos a sus clientes.
* La Sra. Justina viste blusa negra con blanco.
texts.en:
Justina is 49 years old and a teacher by profession.  She has a bookstore called 'Librería Alexis' which she has been running for nearly 20 years.  She learned everything she needed to know about this business from her brother.  Justina currently has two stores: one in her home and another in a university.  She was able to open her second store thanks to loans from EDAPROSPO.  This allowed her to continue growing in her business and achieve many things.  Most importantly, she has managed to provide her son with a good education, build her own home and gain a Masters degree.  All of her achievements are the fruit of her determination and hard work.  Justina is a member of the 'Futuro para el Bien' community bank.  She will invest her current loan in buying school supplies so that her business is well stocked and she is able to offer a variety of goods to her customers.

* Justina is wearing a black and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband and son she keeps a farm, where they cultivate land, grow fruit trees and raise livestock. Anahit would like to increase the number of livestock she owns, for which she needs sufficient means. With the help of this loan, she plans to purchase a pig, a cow and a calf. The farm has all the necessities for livestock: a barn and forage to feed them. So purchasing more livestock will bring Anahit more income and the opportunity to continue the development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, a cow and a calf.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Juntos Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Gresia tiene 03 años trabajando en la venta de productos de belleza. Ella ofrece diferentes marcas del mercado y por la variedad sus clientas van en aumento, fue por medio de su mama que aprendió acerca del negocio; esto le ha servido para ayudar en la economía de su familia gracias e este trabajo ha podido comprar algunas cosas que le hacían falta dentro de su hogar, una cocina y  refrigeradora, también ayuda a pagar algunos servicios, además de esto trabaja como recepcionista en un gimnasio y es donde capta más clientes que la ayudan a realizar más ventas, su préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mas productos básicamente perfumes y colonias. Gresia es secretaria de la alcancía “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO”  ya son 2 años que pertenece al grupo y su mayor deseo en el futuro es seguir ahorrando para tener un spa y salón de belleza.
*Gresia viste casaca blanca.
texts.en:
Gresia has been selling cosmetics for 3 years. She offers different brands, which has increased her clientele. She learned her trade from her mother; it has helped her provide for her family, pay utilities, and buy some things that were needed in her household: a kitchen and refrigerator.

She also works as a receptionist in a gym, where she meets clients who buy her cosmetics. With this loan, she will buy more basic products, particularly perfumes and colognes. Gresia is secretary of the communal bank “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO” [Triumphant Together], to which she has belonged for 2 years. Her most important wish is to continue saving so that she can have a spa and beauty salon. 

*Gresia is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene la edad de 39 años, soltero, labora como técnico en computación, en una empresa privada, vive junto a sus padres y su mayor ahnelo es mejorar la vivienda, haciendo un muro, para reguardar su propiedad. Dando a sus padres mejor seguridad.
Pues se había hecho difícil, ya que no tenía mucho dinero ahorrado, pará comenzar, pero Afodenic, me ha otorgado un financiamiento en donde comprare materiales   y comenzar la construcción del muro. Satisfecho por esta obra, y que espera avanzar bastante.
texts.en: Carlos is 39 years old, single and works as a computer technician in a private company.  He lives together with his parents and his biggest wish is to improve their home, building a wall in order to protect their property.  This will make his parents safer.  It has been difficult because Carlos didn't have much money saved up to start the work.  However, Afodenic have given him a loan to buy materials and start building his wall.  He is happy and hopes to make quite a lot of progress.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for building a wall

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew lives in Liberia, is 40 years old and is married, with four children. He has a 6th grade education. Since 2005 he has been operating a gas station, which he enjoys. Drivers prefer buying gas from Andrew because he has a good location and he was previously a taxi driver. He learned this way of doing business from his parents. 

One problem he faces is that he has an insufficient income. Andrew is requesting a loan to purchase more gas for his business. He plans to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more gas for his business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Alfonso sigue con negocio de fotografía, el cual ha modernizado y comprado mas equipo para su buen servicio, en donde acude a eventos en la toma de fotos, videos, escaneo, entre otros que ofrece. Hoy en día es más fácil su trabajo ya que cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para agilizar y dar mejor resolución a sus fotos.
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara un televisor plasma LCD de 32", con el fin de seguir mejorando su trabajo y tecnología.Ofreciendo a sus clientela rapidez y calidad.
texts.en:
Alfonso continues with his photography business, which he has updated with more equipment that allows him to provide good service. He attends events where he takes photos and videos and offers scanning, among other services. He work is much easier today because he has the tools needed to speed up processing and improve the resolution of his photos. 

With this loan, he will buy a 32" LCD plasma TV to continue improving his work and technology and offering his clients speed and quality.

loans.use: to buy a plasma TV so that he can work faster.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Dastakert town with her husband, son and daughter. The family has a farm, where they raise their three cows and a calf, as well as grow potatoes and walnut, apple and pear trees. Svetlana would like to start sheep breeding, for which she wants to purchase 10 sheep. In addition, she plans to hire workers to cut the grass on the farm, which she will use as forage to feed the livestock.
 
This loan will help Svetlana to earn additional income from sheep breeding and to keep the farm running, which will provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep and cutting the grass

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en: Janet (pictured in the center) is a member of the Adjorman group. They sell rice, sugar, hair and body creams, perfumes and roll-ons in the Teshie neighborhood of Accra. Her 900 GHS loan will allow her to increase her inventory and hopefully increase her profits. Janet has been selling these types of products for eight years. This is her fifth loan cycle, having successfully repaid four previous loans with ID Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, hair and body creams, perfumes, and roll-ons to sell

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José Tomas, trabaja siempre en acarreo comercial, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante también, sus hijos cursando el año escolar, hoy en día, don José, da mantenimiento a su vehículo, siendo el eje principal de su trabajo y pan de cada día.
José ha logrado estas mejoras del vehículo, con préstamos en Afodenic, en donde cada doce a seis meses da mantenimiento general, con el fin de dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, hasta la puerta de su casa. Lo que se siente contento por poder seguir adelante, y con este nuevo financiamiento podrá comprar cuatro llantas nuevas, cambio de filtro, dirección y afinado de motor.
texts.en:
José Tomas is in the commercial transport business.  He has the support of his wife who also works in commerce.  Their children are in school.  José needs to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle as it is his source of income and support.

José has managed to make improvements to his vehicle through loans from Afodenic.
