texts.en: Mrs Duyen was born in 1962. She has a son who got married. Her husband is a guard. His income is 3,000,000 VND a month. Mrs Duyen raises chickens for a living. She gets 2,000,000 VND a month. The total income of her family is 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2006. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in her farm.

loans.use: to invest in her chicken farm

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her children attend college, high school and kindergarten.

She has been operating her own clothing business since 1998 at the largest outdoor market. She imports products from Bejing, China once a month. Summer is a very profitable season in Mongolia; customers need summer suits, dresses, etc., thus she needs new clothes to sell. 

Gantuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase fashionable summer clothes from Beijing in order to increase her current income.  She is our new Kiva client loan who is striving to support her family by her business and give a happy life to her son and daughters.

loans.use: to import summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Zalimon

texts.en: Zalimon is a thirty-two-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been an assistant community development officer for two years. His hardships are low salary pay, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children, upgrading his studies, and building a permanent home. Zalimon wants a loan to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 66 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en universidad. Su marido es taxista.
 
Hace varios años estudio corte y confección en un centro de estudios de Bahía y como nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora  tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección en su casa donde realiza muchos trabajos a las personas que la buscan para que ella les confeccione sus prendas de vestir, pero lo que más cose ropa para damas,  también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas),  agua en bidón y gas de uso domestico, ella trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades desde que amanece el dia  hasta la noche ya que si alguno de sus clientes necesita algo no le incomoda ir a vender ya que su negocio está en su casa. Lleva más de 14 años con su negocio  y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, cosméticos Yanbal, gas y agua en bidón. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y un mejor negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Laureles communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez.  The city is known for its beaches, for its delicious food, and for the warmth of its people.

This is where María, age 66, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has four grown children.  The youngest child attends the university.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Several years ago she studied dressmaking at an educational center in Bahía.  As our friend is a very hard-working woman, she has a small dressmaking shop in her house.  She does a lot of work for people who seek her out to make their clothes.  However, the things she sews the most are women’s clothes.  

She also sells Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories), jugs of water, and gas for domestic use.  She works every day at her diverse business activities.  She works from dawn until evening.  If one of her customers needs something, it does not inconvenience her to go sell it because her business in in her house.  She has had the business for 14 years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy fabric, Yanbal cosmetics, gas, and jugs of water.  She has been in her communal bank since it started.  She likes it because of the help given through the loans.

Her dream is to have a bigger place and a better business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, Yanbal cosmetics, gas, and jugs of water.

loans.name: Alexandra Rosario

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijas de  12, 11 y 5 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y las menores en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y al ver que el no gana mucho en el campo decidió emprender un negocio,  ella vende ropa por catálogos y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, recorre la ciudad visitando a sus clientes, cobrando lo que entrego y realizando nuevos pedidos. Ella lleva seis meses con su negocio y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien a pesar del poco tiempo que lleva con esto.

Este crédito lo va emplear para pagar un pedido que tiene realizado de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace un año  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el Banco.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijas tengan una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, which is known for its beaches, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people, the members of the community bank Los Laureles meet every two weeks.

Alexandra is 35 years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has three daughters, who are 5, 11, and 12 years old.  The oldest is in high school and the youngest attend primary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

In order to earn her own money and help her husband with the household expenses, and seeing that he did not make a lot working in the fields, she decided to open a business.  She sells clothing door to door from catalogs.  She travels around the city visiting her customers, collecting what she is owed, and taking new orders.  She has had this business for six months and she says it is going very well despite the short time she has been doing this work.  

She will use this loan to pay for an order of pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the community bank for a year and she likes it for the help it provides.

Her dream is to give her daughters a very good education.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a vision of educating her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. She has been selling clothes for the last two years, and her main hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and owning one of the most executive boutiques in town. Resty needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty-year-old hardworking woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent home. She has been selling clothes for the last five years and her business is steadily growing. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the different demands of her customers. She has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding her business to new markets. Margret needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 38-year-old mother with four school-going children in a village located near Mombasa, Kenya where business is the most popular economic activity for making a living. Her main sources of income are from charcoal and coconut selling. She has been in this business for over five years. With her current business, she can earn about Ksh 5000 per month.

A first-time borrower, Fatuma is applying for her first loan with Yehu. She will use the entire loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale. She hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to better support her family and also send and keep her children in school.

Fatuma and her family reside in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sokneang

texts.en:
Sokneang (in the photo), age 27, is a garment worker. Her husband, Chhom, age 26, is a construction worker. Besides this, they also grow rice when rice farming season comes. Sokneang is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist in her rice farming. Because she does not have a motorized hand tiller, she borrows one from her father, who is also a rice farmer. With a motorized hand tiller, which she will buy with the money from the loan, Sokneang will have her own and not borrow from her father anymore. 

Sokneang and her husband have been married since 2009 and have one young son. They live a suburb of Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist in her rice farming

loans.name: Blandine Afiavi

texts.fr: Agée de 59 ans, Blandine Afiavi est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un est encore à l'université. Spécilaisée dans la vente des pagnes, des bazins, des sacs et des draps depuis des années, Blandine Afiavi s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire à la forte demande de ses clients qui augmnete sans cesse et d'accroitre son revenu supplémentaire, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev. Le présent financement lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de son enfant.
texts.en: 59 years old, Blandine Afiavi is married and the mother of three children, one of whom is still at university. Specialised in the sale of traditional outfits ('pagnes'), bags and sheets for many years, Blandine Afiavi buys her goods in one of Benin's markets. With the goal of meeting the strong demand from her ever-growing customer base and to increase her supplementary income, she has sought and received assistance from Finadev. This financing will allow her to increase her stock, and to assist with her child's professional eduction.

loans.use: to purchase 12 traditional outfits, 10 damasks, 8 ladies bags and 6 sheets all of different qualities...

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for ten years and is so proud of her profession. Her hardships are high taxes, transportation costs, and low pay. Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent home, and upgrading her studies. Happy intends to use the loan money to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a beautiful single lady who lives in Likoni, in the city of Mombasa. She is one of the few ladies who can stand to take risks without fear. She is still in the care of her parents and therefore lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Roselyn has operated a tailoring business for the last four years after completing her course in tailoring and dressmaking. Thanks to the skills she acquired, she now has the experience to make dresses of various fashions.

Roselyn has narrated to us that she aims to open a boutique and become independent. Her mother is really proud of her even as she tells us that Roselyn is a lady of respect and integrity who has been a useful asset to the entire family. Her customers describe her as someone who is jovial and kind.

This being her first loan with both Yehu and Kiva, she is requesting Ksh 20,000 to buy clothing materials for making clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for making clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children that she supports. She operates a green grocery in the Manjengo area of Narok, and has been in the business for the past four years. Her monthly income is KES 15,000.


She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her green grocery such as assorted vegetables and fruits for sale.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her future dreams is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to stock her green grocery

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno has been involved in corn farming for 15 years now. He had been doing it to meet his family's sustenance in meals and bills at home. Benigno plants and harvests corn. He also pays additional laborers who help him in doing farming activities (land preparation, planting, harvesting) at the cornfield.  

Benigno still aims for crop maintenance and he has insufficient funds now; that is why he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He will be very thankful if this will be granted to him as a way for improving crop production and as well for improvement of their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is an industrious woman who owns and manages a farming business and a hog-raising business to support her family. She has been in these businesses for almost 22 years. At the field, Vann plants and takes care of a few kinds of vegetable crops while she looks after her family and pigs at home. Vann is now 48 years old and a mother of two children, who currently live separately with their new families.

To improve her farming business as well as her pig-raising business, Vann decided to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her crops. Also, with the balance of funds, she will purchase additional pigs and feed for fattening them. Through the loan use, Vann has a strong commitment to work out her plan and upgrade her living standard. Vann hopes to experience a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pigs.

loans.name: Mercy Mayuri

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercy Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y ha procreado 6 hijos, cinco  de ellos son mayores de edad y el menor  tiene 10 años, dos hijos estudian uno en universidad y el menor en escuela y son los que  aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su marido se dedica al comercio, ella vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, sabanas entre otros, además también vende prendas de vestir. Trabaja dos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, la mercadería se la llevan hasta Bahía ya que ella realiza los pedidos y los recibe en su ciudad. Además de esto también tienen un tanquero en el cual reparten agua a las personas que les piden este servicio, para lo cual uno de sus hijos se encarga de esto, ella lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como planchas, licuadoras, camisas, pantalones, etc.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del Banco.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the community bank Los Laureles meeting in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, which is known for its beaches, cuisine, and for the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mercy, who is 49 years old, married, and has six children.  Five of them are adults and the youngest is 10 years old.  One of her children studies at the university and the youngest attends school, and these two live with her.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

In order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, she started a business selling household goods such as irons, blenders, toasters, sheets, and other items.  She also sells clothing.  She works two days a week selling items door to door.  She brings the merchandise to Bahía as she takes the orders and receives them in her city.  In addition to this, they also have a tanker that distributes water to people who ask for this service.  One of her sons is in charge of this business.  She has done this work for more than eight years and she says that it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase more products such as irons, blenders, shirts, and pants.  She has been a member of the community bank from the beginning and is the president.  She likes the help she receives from the bank.  

Her dream is that her younger children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase irons, blenders, shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Maraim

texts.en:
Maraim is 52 years old. She is a widow, and a mother of four children. She has been selling clothes and new handbags to her customers for twelve years and currently earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenyan shillings.

The loan will be used to boost her business by buying more clothes and new handbags for sale.The profits generated will be used to educate her children.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her future hopes and dreams are to purchase her own land plot and build on it.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and new handbags for selling

loans.name: Launh

texts.en:
Launh and his wife, Toch, are farmers. They grow rice and lotus. They are in the process of rebuilding the house they live in, but the house is not yet finished. Hence, Launh has asked for a loan of $1,000 to finish. He will also use a part of his loan to continue his farming business because it’s their main source of income. 

Launh and his wife have been married since 1993 and have two children - a son and a daughter. One is a garment worker and the other is attending primary school. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: to finish his home's construction

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 32 years old, has three children, and is married to Rodento, a farmer. They live in Iguig. To raise the family, the couple operates a farming business. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. Mary Ann also pays laborers who help them in farming activities such as plowing, sowing, planting, and harvesting rice. This has additional expenses for them aside from paying for school fees. So, Mary Ann is borrowing a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs in farming. She hopes that someday she will harvest good crops and gain more profit to pay for school fees and allot funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor costs in farming

loans.name: Satu

texts.fr: Satu est une jeune femme agée de 34 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant . Elle a un petit institut de beauté depuis 4 ans qu'elle gère avec beaucoup de serieux. Elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des produits de beauté et esthétique, des mèches et certains appareils important pour son salon pour pouvoir satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle mais aussi accroitre ses revenus. le benéfice tiré de ce prêt lui permettra d'agrandir son activité avec le temps, de subvenir à ses besoins, mais aussi aux besoins de son enfant qui ira bientôt à l'école.
texts.en: Satu is a young woman aged 34, married and the mother of one child. She has had a small beauty parlour for 4 years, which she runs with a great attention to detail. She is seeking a loan to purchase beauty and esthetic products, hair extensions and some important equipment for the salon; this to be able not only to satisfy her customers but also to grow her income. The profit generated from this loan will allow her to grow her business over time, and to cover her expenses, but also those of her child who will soon be going to school.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Flor Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Flor es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodeado por montañas las cuales le dan un toque especial en el cual se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro se mezcla entre la estructura moderna de sus casas y lo antiguo, su gente se dedica a laborar en la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y muchos han migrado o salen diariamente a laborar en diferentes actividades para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora. Flora tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha concebido una hija de 6 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, iniciándose en este negocio con el primer crédito que realizo en el banco comunal y trabaja de lunes a viernes, en su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos y cuyes.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando frutas y hortalizas para continuar con el negocio y en alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Feria Libre communal bank.  She lives in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca.   This place has a cold climate and is surrounded by mountains.  The mountains give it a special touch in which you can enjoy nature.  Its center is a mix between the modern houses and the ancient.  Its people work in farming, raising animals, and commerce.  Many of them have migrated or leave every day to work at different business activities in order to improve their household finances.

Flor, age 30, is a single mother.  She has a six year old daughter, who goes to school in the city.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in her mother’s house and shares the household expenses.

Flor sells fruit and vegetables.  She started in this business with the first loan she got in her communal bank.  She works from Monday through Friday.  She raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs at her house.

She has been a member of her communal bank for one and a half years.  She will use her new loan to buy fruit and vegetables in order to continue with her business.  She will also buy feed for her animals.

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and animal feed.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun (pictured here) lives in a village about 25 kilometres away from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has six children - four sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and live separately, one is a construction worker, another is a security guard, another attends school, and another is still too young. Her husband, Soeurn, is a fisherman and construction worker. 

Aun is asking for a loan of $400 to connect to a private electricity utility service. The family has to rely on a battery, which is unreliable. She will also use a part of the money from the loan to purchase a motorbike for her son, who is a construction worker, so he can get to work.

loans.use: to connect to a private electricity utility service

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and her two children in a Mongolian boundary town. She runs a grocery store in another town with her husband. She has been running her business for eight years and before that, her store used to run in her backyard. But she moved it in 2010 to another more crowded place in order to increase her customer base.

 Lately her store has a low profit and low sales volume due to her groceries. Recently she funded her son’s starting up a new business from her store business. Now her son has successfully started up his business of auto spare parts sales. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying groceries for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat (in the photo) is 42 years old and her husband, Sophin, is 44 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have son who has full-time employment.  

Savat is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To remodel the house where she lives.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga, 46, runs a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He usually likes to work in his taxi in the mornings and nights, because he has a lot of customers during the nights and mornings of the week. He lives with his family in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. 

His daughter, Nyamdulam, had been living and working in Korea as a contract worker for years. She came home 2 months ago. Now she wants to move from her parents' home and start her own life with her boyfriend. So her father, Battulga, wanted to support her daughter to purchase a house. He will cover some payments of purchasing a plot of land in the ger district. It is quite expensive in Mongolia. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of buying the plot of land. In addition, his daughter, Nyamdulam, said that she would plant vegetables in her backyard for private use and selling.

loans.use: to cover the cost of buying a plot of land

loans.name: Ngirimba

texts.en:
Ngirimba is 47 years old, married, and blessed with six children. He has been a wheat farmer for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

He is servicing his sixth loan of KES 90,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep-keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 47 years old, a farmer, and grocery seller. She resides with her husband and two children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Every day, Chea sells breakfast and foods at intervals between lunch time and dinner time in her community and earns approximately USD 6.40 per day, which is used for daily foods and allowances for her school-aged children. Chea aims to support her two children until they finish their educations in university. She wants to see them become professionals someday and live independent in an appropriate way. Chea’s husband shares his responsibilities for the family by trading firewood and provides for the family with the income.

Chea has encountered difficulties in her traveling without a family-owned vehicle, which is why she decided to take out a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for home use. Also, with a portion of the loan she will purchase firewood to stock for future sale. She is very happy with the support from lenders. She hopes that she will be able to better her living status and obtain a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use

loans.name: Zoila Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por la parroquia de Ricuarte en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida por la variedad de su gastronomía típica, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, se encuentra rodeado por elevaciones y cerros de poca altura.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 51 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes tres son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, su ultima hija tiene 9 años y está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la costura actividad que la aprendió trabajando hace 12 años atrás, ahora trabaja desde su casa sin horario fijo.

Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando telas, encajes, cierres y otros materiales de costura para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una pequeña fábrica.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the "Feria Libre" communal bank. She lives in Ricuarte Parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for the variety of its local cuisine; the people there work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce. The parish is surrounded by low hills.

Zoila is 51 years old. She is a widow, and in her marriage she had four children, three of whom are adults who are married and live independently. Her last daughter is nine years old and is studying in a school in the city. Zoila lives in a house that she owns.

Zoila works in sewing, which she learned while working twelve years ago. Now she works from home without a fixed schedule.
 
This is the fifth loan Zoila has taken out with the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in fabrics, lace, fasteners, and other sewing materials for her business.

Her dream is to have a small factory.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, lace, fasteners, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and she tells us that she’s a merchant; she’s had a food stall for four years that is in a good location, which is a good advantage because she has many customers that way.

Mwanamisi is a very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and continue to grow. She comments that at the beginning her business was small but afterwards, thanks to her work and arduous efforts, she’s been able to grow and improve hers and her family’s income.

She is married to a driver and they have one child who is still very young. They live happily in their own house, though it has no electricity, neither does it have piped water.

She asks for the loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice. She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s getting since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Suvdanchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Suvdanchimeg, 45, runs a waste recycling business with her husband. She receives the wastes and recyclable materials to her collecting point (in her house's backyard). Then she sells them to the waste producing factory and craftsmen who use the recycling materials for their products. She has been running her business for 4 years and she has gained a lot of experience in it. 

She lives with her husband in the ger district, an area of Ulaanbaatar with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. She had a small truck to carry the wastes and recycling materials to her customers and factories. But the truck has broken down and went out of use. So, she is requesting a loan to buy a secondhand truck for her business. She said that, "without my truck I can’t run my business anymore."

loans.use: to buy a secondhand truck for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale through her business

loans.name: Juan De Jesús

texts.es: Juan de Jesús es un hombre muy emprendedor, vive en zona rural en el lado sur del país, posee 15 años de experiencia dedicándose a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles que constituyen los principales granos básicos de la dieta alimenticia Salvadoreña. Juan vive junto a su esposa y seis hijos, familia que siendo muy numerosa constituye la principal inspiración para Juan de Jesús. Él se encarga de sembrar las semillas de maíz y frijol entrando año con año el invierno y gracias a sus constantes y responsables cuidados agrícolas al final obtiene cosechas sanas y abundantes, posteriormente la corta, desgrana manualmente y deposita en sacos que comercializa en tiendas de productos de primera necesidad. Éste es un negocio que le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para poder sacar adelante a su familia y espera seguir haciendo así. Solicita  un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de abono,pesticidas, semillas de maíz y frijoles y de este modo incrementar y mejorar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.-
texts.en: Juan de Jesús is a very entrepreneurial person. He lives in a rural area in the southern part of the country.  He has 15 years of experience working in agriculture planting corn and beans, which make up the basic staples of the El Salvadorean diet. Juan lives with his wife and six children.  His large family is the most important thing to him. Jesus is in charge of planting the corn and beans year after year, and thanks to his constant and responsible care he always obtains healthy and abundant harvests.  After the harvest he manually shells his crop and puts them in sacks to sell at the local stores.  This is the business which has allowed him to provide the necessities for his family and to continue to improve their livelihoods.  He has requested a loan, which will allow him to buy fertilizer, corn, pesticides and beans in large quantity, and by doing so grow and improve his business by being able to provide a better product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn, pesticides and beans in large quantity

loans.name: Arsulita

texts.en:
Arsulita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Arsulita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. Arsulita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Arsulita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Claudeta

texts.en:
Claudeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Claudeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Claudeta has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Claudeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling fermented shrimp in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her fermented shrimp business. Jasmin has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns more income from dried fish vending.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fermented shrimp to sell

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy (in the photo) is 28 years old and his wife, Sova, age 28, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Vuthy is hired to sell recycling materials and gets paid with fees. He wants to launch his own business buying and selling recycling materials, but he does not have capital. Hence, he has decided to apply for a loan to help his capital.

loans.use: to launch a business selling recycling materials

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar en Cuenca, lugar que se caracteriza por la hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, son personas amables, gentiles, de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 64 años, está separada de su marido y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos todos mayores de edad, cinco son casados y viven independientes, tres son solteros, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, y dos de sus hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y sus cosechas las vende y también compra para revender, cría varios animales, trabaja desde muy joven en esta actividad y nos comenta que su sacrificio ha valido la pena ya que algunos de sus hijos son buenos profesionales y otros están cerca de incorporarse de la Universidad.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en el pago de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y la cancelación de dicho crédito lo realizo en las fechas indicadas. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cerdos. La banca comunal le gusta porque son un grupo muy organizado, comparten gratos momentos en cada reunión y también porque reciben una atención personalizada por el promotor de crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Feria Libre community bank.  She lives in the San Pedro del Cebollar neighborhood of Cuenca, an area known for its beautiful view of the city of Cuenca.  The people work in agriculture, raising animals, and commerce.  They are friendly, gentle, warm-hearted people who maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

Rosa is 64 years old, separated from her husband, and has ten children who are all adults.  Five of them are married and live independently, three are single, work, and help financially, and two study at the university in the city.  She owns the house that she lives in.

Rosa works in agriculture.  She plants vegetables and sells her harvests, and also buys for resale.  She also raises various animals, an activity she has done since she was very young.  She commented that her sacrifice has been worth the pain since some of her children are professionals and other are close to starting at the university.

She invested her last loan in paying for her children's university studies, and she paid back the loan on time.  She will use this new loan to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.  

She likes her community bank because the group is very organized, they share pleasant moments at each meeting, and because she receives personal attention from the loan provider.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married; she has eight children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Josephine has taken out and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Eum

texts.en:
Eum is 60 years old. She is widowed and is blessed with four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Two of her children are employed. One is a garment worker and one is a construction worker. They earn approximately $6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Eum is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase groceries to resell. This money would enable her to run an additional business and earn more income to support the family. In the future she would like to expand her grocery store to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is 57 years old and married, with 14 children.

Lenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. Lenita has taken out and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Lenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Lohrama

texts.en:
Lohrama is 73 years old and married, with 6 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lohrama runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Lohrama has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, noodles, and sugar.

In the future Lohrama would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive con su  esposa y sus dos hijos que trabajan la costura al igual que su madre, es una familia emprendedora y muy buenos principios, ellos residen en la Colonia Aurora, en la Ciudad de Tocoa, Colon. Don Alejandro aprendió el oficio de costura desde hace 18 años cuando trabajaba en una talabartería, luego decidió comenzar con su propio negocio de sastrería, y también fabricar monturas de caballos, realizar costura de zapatos  y todo lo que tenga que ver con lo de talabartería. El préstamo que don Alejandro esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de material para fabricar sus monturas, hilo para costurar y todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio. Con la ayuda de este préstamo el podrá surtir su sastrería y talabartería y así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten. Sus aspiraciones como familia es que cada uno de sus hijos tenga en un futuro su propia sastrería. Es el primer financiamiento que don Alejandro solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar de forma puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 56, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and two children who work sewing just like their mother.  It is an enterprising family with very good principles.  They live in the Aurora neighborhood of city of Tocoa in Colon.

Alejandro learned to sew 18 years ago when he worked in a saddlery and then decided to start his own tailoring business and also to manufacture saddles for horses and shoes and everything else to do with saddle-making.

The loan Alejandro’s asking for is needed to buy supplies to manufacture saddles, thread to sew with and everything else needed to stock his business.
With help from this loan he will be able to stock his tailor shop and his saddlery and be able to offer his customers everything they need.

His goal as a family is that each of his children has their own tailor shop in the future.  This is the first loan Alejandro has asked FAMA for and he expects to make his installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy supplies to manufacture saddles.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dinámica. Está casada con Américo, quien se dedica al transporte de carga y es el padre de sus tres 3 hijos; dos ya son independientes. Ahora vive en compañía de último hijo, Arney de 31 años, en su propia casa.

La actividad que ella realiza es la crianza de pollos de granja, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad para 100 pollos instalado en el segundo piso de su vivienda. Los cría y luego vende en el mercado de su localidad. Se inició hace un año con un capital fruto de sus ahorros, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la limpieza y alimentación de los pollos. Le gusta su actividad por poder contar con un ingreso económico extra para los gastos que se presentaran en el hogar y también por sentirse una mujer productiva. Por otro lado, cuenta en una oportunidad se murió parte su producción debido a la peste, ocasionándole pérdidas, que logró superar con el apoyo de MFP.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con esta institución, por lo que cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas para poder tener un buen record crediticio. Y se siente muy bien con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas sociables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1300 nuevos soles, invertirá en el arreglo de su galpón, comprará calaminas para renovar el techo, viruta para el piso, y 150 pollos bebé para empezar con una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Olga, age 54, is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She is married to Américo, who transports cargo and is the father of their three children. Two of them are already independent. They now live with their youngest son Arney, age 31, in their own home.

Olga raises chickens. She has a small coop that has the capacity for housing 100 chickens on the second floor of her home. When the chickens are grown, they are eventually sold at the local market. Olga started this business a year ago using capital from her savings. Her son helps with cleaning the coop and feeding the chickens. She enjoys this business because she is able to have additional income for unexpected household expenses. Working also makes her feel like a productive woman. On one occasion several of her chickens died as a result of disease, which resulted in losses. She was able to overcome that setback with the support from MFP.

This is her fourth loan with the organization. Since she has completed her payments, Olga has established a good credit record. She feels very good about her Communal Bank since she considers all of the members to be sociable and supportive. The amount of 1,300 PEN that she requested will be invested in repairs to her chicken coop. She will buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof and organic scrap to spread on the floor. In addition, she will acquire 150 baby chicks so that she can start a new production cycle.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her chicken coop and to purchase 150 baby chicks.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo continua con su negocio de taxi, pues lleva once años dando su servicio, sus hijos cursando el año escolar y su esposa labora como docente y vende nacatamales el fin de semana apoyándolo en los gastos básicos.
Don Adolfo desea cambiar el techo, el que tiene es nicalit, en mal estado, por tal razón comprara zinc, perlines, golosos, para mejorar su techo y asegurar a su familia. Mejoras que ha venido logrando con los financiamientos dados por Afodenic.
texts.en:
Adolfo continues with his taxi business; he’s been providing service for 11 years.  His children are attending school and his wife works as a teacher and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] on the weekend helping him to cover basic expenses.

Adolfo wants to replace the roof.  The one he has is made of Nicalit and it’s in poor shape which is why he wants to buy metal sheeting, purlines and screws to improve the roof and safeguard his family.  These are improvements he’s been accomplishing with loans gotten from Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y dinámica. Su pareja es David, con quien tiene tres hijos: Frank de 14 años, Anthony de 12 años y Kayli de 3 años.

Se dedica a la costura, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Empezó instalando su propio taller en su casa con una sola máquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros, ahora cuenta con tres máquinas. Ha logrado hacerse conocida atendiendo los requerimientos de sus clientes que han ido en aumento. Lleva en este oficio más de 8  años y a veces cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana. Le está yendo muy bien, es por eso que tienen planes de mejorar el acabado de sus prendas comprando una máquina semindustrial.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que está contenta de saber que cuenta con un  apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Es así que se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen récord crediticio.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura (telas, hilos, elásticas, botones, etc.) buscando los precios bajos por sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Yovany is 35 years old. She is a very hardworking woman, cheerful and dynamic. Her husband is David, with whom she has three children: fourteen-year-old Frank, twelve-year-old Anthony, and Kayli, who is three years old. 

Yovany works as a seamstress, a skill that she leaned when she was very young and studying in an occupational education center. She began setting up her own workshop in her house with just one sewing machine that she bought with her savings; now she has three machines. She has managed to make herself known, meeting the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She has had this business for eight years; at times, her sister helps her. It has been going very well, which is why she has plans to improve the finish of her garments by buying a semi-industrial sewing machine.

This is her first loan with the MFP institution; she is happy to know that she has the financial support to make her plans a reality. She is committed to being responsible with her loan payments so that she will have a good credit history.

With the amount requested, 1000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in the purchase of a sewing materials (fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.), seeking out the lowest wholesale prices for her purchases.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials for the production of her garments.

loans.name: Baldomer

texts.es:
Baldomer tiene 42 años, es un hombre empeñoso, dedicado y con muchas ganas de progresar. Está casado con Joana, quien es la madre de sus tres hijos; Jonathan, Diana y Valesca de 18, 14 y 4 años respectivamente. 
Instaló (en su casa) su consultorio obstétrico donde brinda el servicio de control pre y post natal. Viene realizando esta actividad desde hace más de 9 años, contando con la ayuda de una técnica en enfermería. Con ello obtiene ingresos adicionales a su trabajo en el centro de salud de su localidad. Adicionalmente, cuenta con habitaciones que da en alquiler, tiene 10. Su deseo a futuro es ampliar e implementar mejor su consultorio.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado para avanzar con su negocio y concretar sus planes. Por tanto, será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la ampliación de su consultorio, comprando mobiliario nuevo (camillas y sillas) para la comodidad de sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Baldomer, 42, is an enterprising, dedicated man who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s married to Joana who is the mother of his three children: Jonathan, Diana and Valesca who are 18, 14 and 4 years old respectively.

He opened an obstetrics office at home where he provides pre- and post-natal care.  He’s been in this business for more than nine years; he has help from a nursing technician.  He earns extra income this way in addition to what he earns at his job at a local health center.  In addition, he also has 10 rooms he rents.  His future goal is to expand and better equip his medical office.

This is his fourth MFP loan and he feels grateful for the loan granted to improve his business and to carry out his plans.  He will, therefore, be responsible with his payments like he’s been with his previous loans.

He will use the requested 1500 new soles to invest in the expansion of his medical office; he will buy new furniture (cots and chairs) for his patients’ comfort.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
Don Silvio continua laborando en una gasolinera como tecnico de pista, cada 24 horas, su esposa cuida a sus tres hijos, para el, las mejora  a su casa es de gran relevancia, donde ha venido  mejorando por ciclo con financiamiento que Afodenic sigue otorgando.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, cambiara parte del techo y embaldozara, teniendo mejor higiene y comodidad para su familia. materiales a comprar: arena, cemento,piedrin, laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera y clavos. Para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvio continues working in a gas station as an attendant every 24 hours.  His wife cares for their three children.  For him, making home improvements is of great importance and he’s been making these improvements with each loan cycle Afodenic continues to grant him.

With this new loan today he will replace the roof and will plaster leading to better hygiene and comfort for his family.  He will buy supplies like sand, cement, gravel, metal sheets, wood beams and nails to start the project.

loans.use: to plaster and to replace the kitchen's roof.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Don Timoteo de 53 años de edad,tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos,de los cuales 3 estan estudiando actualmente,el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de ejote frances y al cultivo de frijol de suelo, maiz, café.y otros vejetales, por la calidad de su productos sus clientes ban a comprarlo al lugar donde el cultiva,de esta fuente es que don timoteo abtiene recursos para darles estudio a sus hijos,el le da gracias a Dios porque gracias a los credito que Kiva le a otorgado a podido ir creciendo en su cultivo,les agradese la confianza que le han depositado a su persona, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de quimico organico para abonar su cultivo, y tambien para la compra de cajas plasticas para poder transportar su producto,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Don Timoteo is 53 years old and is responsible for four children, three of whom are currently studying. For the past 10 years, he has been growing French-style green beans (haricot verts) on his land as well as corn, coffee, and other vegetables. His customers buy his products in quantity directly from his farm. This source of income is how Don Timoteo is able pay for his children’s education. He gives thanks to God for being able to obtain a Kiva loan so that he can continue growing his crops. In addition, he appreciates the trust that has been demonstrated to him as a person.

Timoteo will buy chemicals and organic matter for fertilizing his crops. He will also purchase plastic crates so that he can transport his products. Timoteo hopes the loan he requested will be helpful.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and to acquire plastic crates for transporting his products.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa. Su pareja es Rony, quien es el padre de sus seis hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja.

Su actividad es la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros artículos de uso personal. Su mercadería la compra en los centros comerciales de su localidad y los vende en los caseríos ubicados a la rivera de los ríos, realizando viajes periódicos a esa zona. Empezó con este negocio hace 4  años, con un capital propio, luego fue creciendo con préstamos de MFP y con el apoyo de su pareja, trabajan juntos. Le gusta su actividad porque que la mantiene ocupada y le permite visitar a su madre que vive en uno de los caserío que visita. Pero comenta que es un negocio con bastante desgaste físico y no le permite estar el tiempo suficiente con sus hijos. Por eso desea incursionar en otro que pueda realizar en su casa, como una tienda de comestibles.

Este es el préstamo número 8 que tiene con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Por tal motivo, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada (linternas, pilas, ropa, productos de belleza y otros) para seguir con su actual negocio.
texts.en:
Celia, 41, is a hardworking, very enterprising woman.  Her partner is Rony who is the father of their six children who she loves very much and are her motivators.  They live together in their own house that she managed to build with support from her spouse.

Her activity is selling clothes, shoes and other personal use items.  She buys her merchandise in local shopping centers and sells them in hamlets located along the river banks making periodic trips to these areas.  

She started the business four years ago with her own capital and then grew with MFP loans and with support from her spouse; they work together.  She likes her activity because she keeps busy and she’s able to visit her mother who lives in one of the hamlets she visits.  But she comments that it’s a business that’s very demanding physically and keeps her from spending much time with her children which is why she’d like to go into some other type of business like a grocery store that she can do from home.

This is MFP loan #8 and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to advance with her business.  Because of this she commits to be responsible with her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  On the other hand, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers its members to be responsible people.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy assorted merchandise (flashlights, batteries, clothes, beauty products and others) to continue with her current business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Getulio

texts.es:
Getulio tiene 37 años, es un hombre trabajador, alegre y con ganas de superación. Viven con sus dos hijos (Getulio de 21 y Eder de 19 años de edad) y su madre.
Su actividad es la venta ambulatoria de golosinas y plátanos fritos conocidos como “chifles”. También alquila su motocarro para generarse un ingreso adicional. Las golosinas y los plátanos fritos los elabora en su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos y los lleva a vender caminando por los diferentes barrios de la ciudad. Decidió iniciar este negocio hace más de 4 años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y hacerse conocido. Considera rentable a esta actividad porque es fácil de realizar y por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además le gusta socializar y hacer amistades. Su deseo es crecer y producir en mayor volumen para vender, al por mayor, a las bodegas.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Es así que se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio porque quiere acceder a otros créditos más adelante.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de gran variedad de golosinas y platanitos fritos, preparándose para las fiestas locales del mes de junio. También desea comprar un motor nuevo para su motocarro valorizado en 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Getulio, 37, is a hardworking, cheerful man who very much wants to get ahead.  He lives with his two sons, Getulio, 21, and Eder, 19, and with his mother.

He is a street vendor.  He sells snacks and fried plantain known as “chifles.”  He also leases out his car to earn additional income.  He makes the snacks and fried plantain at home with help from his sons and goes out walking throughout the various neighborhoods in his city to sell them.  He decided to start this business over four years ago and this time has served for him to grow and become well-known.  He considers his work to be profitable because it’s easy to do and it generates good profits; besides he enjoys socializing and making friendships.  His desire is to grow and produce in larger volumes to sell to stores at wholesale.

This is his first MFP loan and he hopes to continue towards his objectives.  He commits to be responsible with his installment payments to have a good credit history because he wants to access more loans later on.

He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy ingredients to make the wide variety of snacks and fried plantains to get ready for the June festivals.  He also wants to buy a new engine for his vehicle that costs 600 new soles.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Bassangou Kheweul Group

texts.fr:
Bassangou  Khewel  est un groupement féminin composé de 5 membres et est situé à environ quelques kilomètres de la caisse, ce groupement s’active dans le commerce (vente de friperie, de produits alimentaires et non alimentaires, d’aliments de bétail).IL est dirigé par sa présidente Mme Ouleye âgée de 58 ans mariée et mère de famille.
Mme Ouleye s’active dans  le commerce  depuis  15 ans, elle achète ses marchandises à Dakar pour ensuite les revendre, elle a aménagé une place chez elle.
Mme Oulèye roule avec un stock de 150 000 et  gagne au moins 25 000 le mois, de ce fait elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 pour  acheter de la friperie, des savons, des produits cosmétiques  et d’huile de palme, pour avoir un bénéfice plus important qui lui permettra de faire face aux charges personnelles. Mme Oulèye veut un jour avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Bassangou Khewel is a group  composed of five women and  based just a few kilometers from the credit institution's branch. The group members work as vendors (used clothing, food products and other items, animal feed). The group is  organized by its chair, Mrs. Ouleye, who is 58 years old and married, with children.

Mrs. Ouley has been working as a vendor for 15 years. She buys her goods in Dakar in order to resell them out of her home.
Mrs. Ouley has a working capital of 150,000 West African francs and earns at least 25,000 francs per month. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 in order to buy used clothing, soap, cosmetics, and palm oil, in order to earn higher revenues and provide for her personal needs. One day she would like to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, palm oil, soap and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda tiene 66 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Está separada del padre de sus cuatro hijos. Vive en compañía de dos de ellos; Elva de 34 años y Benjamín de 27 años, en su casa propia, la que compró con mucho esfuerzo.
Su negocio es el alquiler de su motocarro para el uso de transporte de pasajeros. Lo hace desde hace 7 años y lo considera muy rentable porque recibe ganancias diarias. Lo que le gusta es que puede manejar sus tiempos, ya que en la mañana trabaja como docente en un colegio de su localidad, a medio tiempo. Pero inició su negocio para tener ingresos económicos adicionales, ya que su sueldo no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Ahora se siente más tranquila y cómoda, ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Sus planes a futuro son de implementar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP.  Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores y tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, comprando un motor nuevo valorizado en 600 nuevos soles, además de repuestos para tener operativo su vehículo.
texts.en:
Rosenda, 66, is a hardworking woman who has a strong desire to succeed.  She is separated from the father of her four children.  She lives in her own home, which she bought with a lot of effort, with two of her children: Elva, 34, and Benjamin, 27. 

Rosenda has a business renting out a moto-taxi that is used to transport passengers.  She has been doing this for 7 years, and she considers this business to be very profitable because she receives daily earnings from it.  What she likes about this business is that she can organize her time, because in the mornings she is a teacher who works in a local school on a part-time basis.  She started her business to have some additional income, because her salary was not sufficient to cover all of the expenses of her children.  Now she feels more tranquil and comfortable, because she has a regular income and has more free time.  In the future, she plans to set up a grocery store in her house.

This is her 14th loan from MFP, and she is committed to making her payments as she did with her previous loans so that she can maintain a good credit record.  With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will invest in some maintenance work on her moto-taxi, buying a new motor valued at 600 soles and some spare parts to keep her vehicle operating.

loans.use: to buy a motor and some parts for her moto-taxi

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Kevin, quien es el padre de sus tres hijos: Kevin de 9 años, Arison de 2 años y Adriana de 4 meses de nacida.  Viven en la casa que logró construir junto con su pareja.

Su negocio es la venta de comestibles y abarrotes en general. Tiene una pequeña bodega que logró acondicionar en su vivienda, notando la necesidad de sus vecinos de adquirir sus productos en un lugar más cercano. Lleva ya 7 meses, tiempo en el que logró hacerse conocida y ganar una regular clientela. Hasta el momento lo viene realizando con la ayuda de su pareja, en sus ratos libres, para la atención. Le gusta su actividad por poder estar en casa y atender a sus menores hijos, este fue el principal motivo por el cual se decidió a abrir una bodega en casa, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en un puesto de ventas en el mercado.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se siente contenta de la oportunidad brindada para poder contar con un capital de trabajo, y como desea seguir contando con este apoyo, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará mayor variedad de comestibles y abarrotes, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera aumentará su stock de mercadería.
texts.en:
Nilda, 30, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman.  Her spouse is Kevin who is the father of their three children: Kevin, 9, Arison, 2, and Adriana, 4-months-old.  They live in the house she managed to build with her spouse.

Her business is selling food and groceries in general.  She has a small store she managed to set up at home noting the need her neighbors had of acquiring products in a closer location.  She’s been open for 7 months and has become known and established a clientele in that time.  To date, she’s been working with help from her spouse who helps her in his free time to tend to customers.  She likes this activity because she’s able to stay home and care for her minor children; this was the main reason why she decided to open a store at home since she used to work in a sales stand in the market.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s happy about the support provided in order to have working capital and since she wants to continue with this business she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She’s also happy in her communal bank because of the support they give each other.

She will use the requested 1800 new soles to buy a larger variety of food items and groceries seeking out low prices for volume purchases thus increasing her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yuvis

texts.es:
Yuvis tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de amable y cordial. Su pareja es Enrique, quien se dedica al transporte y es el padre de su hijo Jhesci, de 13 años. 
Su actividad es la compra de motos y motocarros usados, los repara y los vende a precios más altos. Inició este negocio hace más de 3 años por idea de su pareja, juntos trabajan en el taller que implementaron en su vivienda. Adicionalmente, tiene un empleo de medio tiempo en una empresa de su localidad, pero ese sueldo no le era suficiente, ahora con este negocio pueden solventar todos los gastos de la familia. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo hasta tener una tienda para la venta de motos.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por lo que está contenta y agradecida de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de un motocarro usado valorizado en 3800 nuevos soles, además de los repuestos para su reparación.
texts.en:
Yuvis, 30, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being nice and kind.  Her spouse is Enrique who works in transportation and is the father of their son, Jhesci, 13.

Her activity is buying and selling used motorcycles and cars.  She repairs them and then sells them at higher prices.  She started the business more than three years ago; it was her spouse’s idea.  They work together in the shop they set up at home.  In addition, she has a part-time job at a local firm but this salary is insufficient.  With this business they are now able to cover family expenses.  She plans to continue growing and eventually have a motorcycle sales store.

This is MFP loan #6.  She is happy and grateful to know that she will continue to have a line of credit to advance with her business.  She commits to make her payments like she’s done in the past.

She will use the requested 4000 new soles to buy a used car that costs 3800 new soles as well as spare parts to repair it.

loans.use: to buy a used vehicle and spare parts for it to repair and resell it.

loans.name: Cicilio

texts.es:
Cicilio tiene 54 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre. Está casado con Sirila, la madre de sus cuatro hijos. Ahora solo viven con dos de ellos; Juan de 32 y Luís de 16 años.
Tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual atiende su esposa. Pero también cuenta con un motocarro desde hace 10 años con el que realiza servicio de transporte de pasajeros en sus ratos libres. La bodega la tienen hace más de un año, tiempo que le valió para crecer y ampliar, llegando a tener muchos clientes, en su mayoría a vecinos, y hasta el momento cuenta con la compañía y ayuda de su esposa en la atención. Anteriormente tenía un puesto de venta en el mercado, pero le resulto muy cansado la rutina, decidiendo cambiar y abrir un negocio en la comodidad de su casa para que pueda descansar. Le gusta su actividad, porque puede conocer a sus vecinos y hacer amistades, además de los ingresos económicos con los cuales cubre los gastos de su hogar. Ahora tiene pensado comprar un teléfono público para brindar ese servicio a sus vecinos y tener más ingresos económicos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está contento de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio y concretar sus planes de negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas como en el crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de un teléfono publico valorizado en 1200, con lo restante adquirirá más abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Cicilio is 54 years old. He is a very hardworking and cheerful man. He is married to Sirila, the mother of his four children. Now they only live with two of them: Juan, who is 32 years old, and Luis, who is 16.

They have a food shop in their house, tended by his wife. They also have had a "motocarro" [a three-wheeled van] for ten years, with which they provide a low-cost passenger transportation service. 

They have had the shop for more than one year; they've used this time to grow and increase their stock. They now have many customers, the majority of whom are their neighbors, and so far Cicilio has had the help and company of his wife in running the store. Before, he had a stall in the market, but he found the routine very tiring. He decided to make a change and open a business in the comfort of their own house so they could rest. They like this business, because they can get to know their neighbors and make friends; in addition, they use the economic income to cover household costs. Now, Cicilio is planning to buy a public telephone so he can offer that service to his neighbors and have more income.

This is the second loan with the institution MFP; Cicilio is happy to know that he continues to have financial support to move forward with his business and make his business plans a reality. He is committed to making his loan payments as he did with the previous loan. 

With the amount requested—1,800 nuevos soles (PEN)—Cicilio will invest in the purchase of a public telephone worth 1200 PEN; with the rest, he will buy more groceries to stock his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a public telephone and stock up his store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 54 años, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además de ser alegre y sociable. Su pareja es Ramiro, quien es maestro de construcción civil, y el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en su casa propia, la que construyó en el terreno que compró años atrás, en compañía de su hija y sus dos nietos.

Ella se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, tiene 10, las que instaló en la parte de atrás de su vivienda, cobrando 100 nuevos soles por cada una. Empezó hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, logrando hacer crecer su negocio de a pocos, y el tiempo le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. Esto le permite tener un ingreso económico regular para el sostén de su familia y poder pagar los estudios de sus nietos. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está agradecida al saber que seguirá contando con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como lo fue anteriormente.

Con el préstamo solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de construcción (fierros, tubos, clavos y demás) y pagará la mano de obra para construir más habitaciones y así poder recibir más inquilinos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 54, is a woman who very much wants to make progress; she’s cheerful and sociable too.  Her spouse is Ramiro who is a master builder and the father of their two children.  She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in her own house that she built on a lot she bought years ago.

She rents rooms; she has ten that she built in the back of her house.  He charges 100 new soles for each one.  She started over five years ago with capital of her own and gradually her business grew.  This time has served for her to become well-known which makes it possible for her to have regular income to support her family and pay for her grandchildren’s schooling.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s grateful to know that she will continue to have financial support to advance her business.  She, therefore, commits to be responsible with her payments like she’s been so far.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy building materials and supplies (rebar, tubes, nails and others) and will pay labor costs to build more rooms and be able to have more tenants.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Lydia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Charlenia

texts.es:
Charlenia tiene 25 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre, muy dinámica y deseosa de progresar.  Su pareja es José, quien se dedica al transporte. No tienen hijos y por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida (salchichas con pollo, pollos frito y otros típicos de la región) y gaseosas. Para esto instala una mesa en el frontis de su vivienda donde atiende a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Esta labor la empieza por la tarde, con todos los preparados de sus comidas, ya que por la mañana trabaja como docente en un colegio de su localidad. Esta contenta porque con este negocio puede tener un ingreso económico adicional a su sueldo mensual como profesora, con lo que puede solventar todos los gastos de su familia. El problema es que termina muy cansada por todo el trabajo del día, pero a pesar de eso desea continuar con su negocio hasta lograr tener un local donde atender a sus clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio (ollas, platos, vasos), además de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Charlenia, 25, is a hardworking, cheerful, very dynamic woman who very much wants to make progress.  Her spouse is José who works in transportation.  They have no children and for the moment are living in her in-laws’ house.

Her activity is selling fast-food (sausages with chicken, fried chicken and others typical of the region) and soft-drinks.  To do so she sets up a table in front of her house where she tends to her customers who for the most part are her neighbors.  She starts her work in the afternoon preparing her dishes because she works mornings as a teacher at a local school.  She is happy because with this business she’s able to earn income in addition to her monthly teacher’s salary that she can use to cover all her family’s expenses.  The problem is that she ends up very tired after all the day’s work but despite this she wants to continue with her business until she can have a locale where she can take care of her customers.

This is her first MFP loan.  She comments that she’s grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to reach her goals.  She, therefore, commits to make her installment payments.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy utensils (pots, dishes, glasses) for her business as well as ingredients and supplies to make her food.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 71 years old, married, with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase another computer.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase another computer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 53 years old and married, with 6 children. With one child in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.
