Myrna has been in this business for 9 years.  She sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles, snack foods, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell at her general store

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 12 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por el cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas las que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares, su gente aun mantienen la vestimenta, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Lidia Rocio, tiene 21 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 5 años de edad quien ingresara este año a la escuela. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa es de su propiedad construida con el trabajo conyugal.

La Señora Lidia Rocio se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, como pasa en casa aprovecha el tiempo para dedicarse a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas las mismas que vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad de Cuenca, también cría y vende cerdos y gallinas, en estas actividades se encuentra hace 7 años.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y también llantas para un vehículo de su propiedad.

Su meta es tener un negocio más estable como una tienda.
texts.en:
Entrada a Chunazaca Communal Bank is made up of 12 women and 1 man who live in Nabón Canton, a place of rugged geography with a cold climate and large expanses for enjoying nature beyond the routine of the city.  The residents work raising animals and in agriculture, and many of them leave the city every day to do various types of work, which allows them to improve the household finances.  The people still preserve the dress, culture, and traditions of their communities.  They are pleasant, kind, and warm hearted.

One of the members of this group is Lidia Rocío, 21.  She is married and from this relationship has a five-year-old child who will begin school this year.  Her husband works in the construction field as a bricklayer.  Her house is her own property, built with her husband's labor.

Lidia Rocío works in the home and taking care of her son.  Since she is at home, she makes the most of the time to work in agriculture.  She grows vegetables that she sells in her community or in the city of Cuenca.  She also raises and sells pigs and chickens.  She has been doing this work for seven years.

She is on her second loan with the communal bank and she's going to invest it in buying manure, seeds, and also tires for a vehicle she owns.

Her goal is to have a more stable business, such as a store.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and tires.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 29 years old and married.

Cristine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her business.

Cristine has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Cristine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell for her business

loans.name: Kary

texts.es:
Kary tiene 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Edson, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos: Kary de 12 años y Linda de 7 años, a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada.

Su actividad es la venta de comestibles variados, para eso cuenta con un espacio en su casa donde almacena su mercadería. Los productos los adquiere en los centros comerciales de la ciudad para luego llevarlos a caseríos a las riveras del río, por lo que realiza viajes periódicos. Se inició hace más de 2 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo su pareja para la compra de la mercadería y en la venta sus familiares residentes en los caseríos que visita. Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea ampliar el negocio con la venta de ropa, además de los comestibles.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de comestibles y ropa, al por mayor, buscando los precios más bajos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Kary is 46 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Edson is her partner. They have two children they love very much, Kary, who is twelve years old, and Linda, who is seven years old. They live together in a rented house.

She sells a variety of groceries. She stores her merchandise in a room in her house. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city and then takes them to the riverside communities along the banks of the river. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over two years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise, and her relatives who live in the riverside communities she visits help her to make sales. As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling clothing in addition to groceries.

This is her second loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma], and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. Additionally, she feels good about her communal bank since she knows the other members and considers them to be responsible and caring people.
She will invest the requested amount of 1000 PEN [$400] by purchasing groceries and clothing at wholesale prices. She will look for the lowest prices to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josh

texts.en:
Josh is 50 years old. He is married to Ruth, and they have four children, aged four to 12 years.  His wife is a business lady and contributes additional income to the family.

Josh has been selling eggs for two years, and he has a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to purchase more eggs for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to support his children.

This is the first loan with KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams are to grow his business to sustain his family.

loans.use: to buy  more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 50 years old and married, with 6 children.

He earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Efren is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for his livestock.

Efren has been raising livestock for 3 years, and he also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising chickens.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream:  to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for his livestock.

loans.name: Koem Sien

texts.en:
Koem Sien, a soldier, and his wife, Chamroeun, a cleaner, have been married since 1983 and have three sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Koem Sien is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 to help his son launch a business selling cell phones, Mp3 and Mp4 players, and installing cell phone application. He will use the money to purchase a computer desktop and buy cell phones for resale.

loans.use: to help  his son launch business selling cell phones, Mp3 and Mp4 players, and installing cell phone applications.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 50 years old and married with six children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling piglets in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of piglets business for 16 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to sell

loans.name: Kulsaira

texts.ru:
Кулсайре 60 лет, вдова, имеет 6 детей. Кулсайра в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулсайры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 35 овец, 2,28 га земли с фасолью, продажа молока приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку удобрений и семян для посева.  Доходы от кредита Кулсайра будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kulsaira is 60 years old, a widow, with six children. As a main source of income for her family, for 35 years Kulsaira has been engaged in farming and raising livestock, having launched this business  with a starting capital of 25,000 KGS. Thanks to Kulsaira’s hard work, at present her farm includes three cows with calves, 35 sheep, 2.28 ha [about 5.6 acres] of land for growing beans. Milk sales bring in about 5,000 KGS per month.

In order to develop his business further, Kulsaira has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for the planting season. Kulsaira plans to reinvest her revenues from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and married, with 2 children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed, and repaid, 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for 5 years, and she also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (in the photo), 51, and her husband Tun, 58, a driver for a company, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1981 and have one son who is a cell phone repairman and two daughters who are garment workers.

Vanny is a housewife whose main sources of income are her husband and children’s salaries. Vanny’s son wants to supplement his salary by selling cell phones and Mp3 and Mp4 players and installing cell phone applications. She is therefore requesting a loan for $1,000 in order to help him purchase a computer desktop and cell phones for resale.

loans.use: to help her son to supplement his income by selling cell phones and Mp3 and Mp4 players and installing cell phone applications.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora is 57 years old and married with seven children.

Diodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Diodora has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from selling clothing.

Diodora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling firewood and plastic wares. Miguela is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Miguela has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 45 years old and married, with 3 children.

Pablita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her store.

Pablita has borrowed, and repaid, 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and she also earns an income from dressmaking.

Pablita aspires to save enough money that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell at her store

loans.name: Junay

texts.en:
Junay is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Junay runs a coconut wine retail business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.
Junay has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the coconut wine retail business for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Junay aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 20 años, es una mujer buena, perseverante y emprendedora. Su pareja desde hace un año es Paul, con quien tiene un bebe de 10 meses de nacido. Actualmente vive en una casa alquilada que paga con el dinero que obtiene a diario de su trabajo.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de buffet y organización de fiestas. Prepara tortas, postres y comidas, dependiendo del tipo de reunión. Lleva realizando este trabajo por cinco años, se inició ayudando a su madre en la misma actividad, ella fue su mejor maestra. Pudo iniciar su propio negocio hace 3 años y lo hace en compañía de su cónyuge. Le va muy bien y tiene planes de consolidar su sueño de tener un taller de repostería totalmente equipado en su casa. Es por eso que espera seguir trabajando para más adelante tener una pastelería.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará todo lo que necesita para implementar su negocio de repostería; como bases de torta, artículos decorativos, colorantes, moldes e ingredientes.
texts.en:
Milagros is 20-years-old and is good woman who is entrepreneurial and has a lot of perseverance.  Her partner of a year is Paul who she has a 10-month-old baby with.  She currently lives in a rented house that she pays for with the money she earns from her job. 

Milagros works providing party planning and buffet services.  She prepares cakes, desserts, and meals – depending on the type of gathering.  She has been doing this work for five years.  She began by helping her mother with the same work, her mother was her best teacher.  She was able to open her own business three years ago and she did so with her partner.  It is going very well for her and she plans to put into action her dream of having a cake-baking workshop in her house.  This is why she hopes to continue working so that in the future she can have a cake shop.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is thankful for the opportunity and confidence shown in her.  She commits to follow through with her payments in a punctual fashion and also is thankful to be a part of the communal bank she belongs to, as she has seen that the members are responsible and committed to each other.

With the amount she is requesting (2000 nuevos soles), she will buy everything she needs to begin her baking business, such as: cake boards, decorative tools, food colorings, pans, and ingredients.

loans.use: to buy tools for the cake decorating she does.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 3 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, portas, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, subir de categoria para aumentar o seu salário, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir um meio de transporte para melhorar as condições de deslocação para o seu serviço.
texts.en:
Manuel is a widower and father to 3 children who all attend school. He does not financially support anyone else.
He is a soldier and a member of staff at the Ministry of Defense. With this loan he intends to buy building materials (windows, doors, cement, sand stone and other items) in order to continue building his home.
In the future he hopes to finish his house and rise in the ranks in order to increase his salary. Consequently, he promises to keep to his repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is acquiring his own transport to improve the conditions in which he travels to his workplace.

loans.use: to buy building materials (windows, doors, cement, sand, stone and other items).

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 43 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.
Cynthia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for seven years and also earns income from farming rice.
Cynthia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 47 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fishing.
Juanita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Teodora has been raising pigs for 21 years and also earns additional income from "nipa" making (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair). She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Urselina

texts.en:
Urselina is 49 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Urselina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.
Urselina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Casada e sem filhos, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É cabeleireira e faz curso de contabilidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, concluir o seu curso, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de transporte para o seu material de compra para a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana is married without children. She lives in her own  home and does not financially support anyone else.
She is a hairdresser and is also studying on an accounting course. With this loan she intends to buy building materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items) in order to continue building her home.
In the future she hopes to finish building her house and complete her course; consequently, she promises to adhere to her repayment schedule so that she can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge that she faces is due to her lack of transport for the products that she carries for her work.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items).

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 61 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Allen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Allen has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years and also earns an income from dressmaking.
Allen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadsalim

texts.en:
Mahmadsalim is a man who has much experience in business. For more than 20 years he has been busy with collective farming. He grows different kinds of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions and others. He takes pleasure in his work and loves it very much – that’s why his harvest is of a high quality. 
Mahmadsalim is very kind and good-natured. His family loves him very much and helps him in his business. He has 11 children and a lovely wife. His sons and daughters help to grow and sell vegetables. His goods attract many customers at the market. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new season. If you are able to help him he will be very happy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris tiene 42 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Su pareja es Bettman, el padre de sus tres hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que logro construir con mucho esfuerzo con el apoyo de su pareja.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces variados, los cuales prepara en casa en un horno artesanal; luego los lleva, según pedido, a las bodegas y tiendas de comestibles de su zona y otros caseríos alejados de la ciudad. Realiza esta actividad hace más de 2 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos para la elaboración y reparto de los dulces, de esa manera logran acabar todos sus productos y dar mayor rotación a su capital. Le gusta su actividad, pues la mantiene ocupada, motivo por el que se decidió a empezar con este negocio, además de contar con un ingreso económico que le permita apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Y además, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus compañeros personas solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá  en la compra de una amasadora de harina, traída desde la capital y valorizada en 2000 nuevos soles. Con lo restante adquirirá insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de los dulces.
texts.en:
Damaris is 42 years old. She is a woman with lots of business experience, and is also happy and kind. Her partner is Bettman. He is the father of her three children. They live together in their own house, which they managed to build together after putting out a lot of effort.

She makes and sells a variety of sweets which she prepares at home in a wood-fired brick oven. She then delivers them, according to her orders, to the corner stores and grocery stores in her area and in other riverside communities outside the city. She has been working this way for more than two years. Her children help her to make and distribute the sweets. This way they manage to sell all her products and turn over her capital quickly. She enjoys what she does, especially since it keeps her busy, which is one of the reasons she decided to start her business. She also wanted to have a source of income which would allow her to help her partner cover their living expenses and educate their children.

This is her fourth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She is committed to making her loan payments on time, as she did with her previous loans. Additionally, she feels good about her communal bank since she considers the other members to be caring people.
She will invest the requested amount of 2500 PEN [$950] by purchasing a flour mixer, which she will bring from the capital and which is valued at 2000 PEN [$750]. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients to make sweets.

loans.use: to purchase a flour mixer and ingredients for her sweets.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de uma filha ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É Mecânico, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleiras, cimento cola, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja progredir profissionalmente e terminar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir uma posição melhor no seu serviço para aumentar a sua renda mensal.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a married father with a young daughter. He lives in his own home and does not financially support anyone else.
He is a mechanic, and with this loan he intends to buy building materials (tiles, cement, glue, sand, stone, doors and other items) in order to continue building his home.
In the future he hopes to progress professionally and to finish building his house; consequently, he promises to adhere to his repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is attaining a better position at work so that he can increase his monthly wage.

loans.use: to buy building materials (tiles, cement, glue, sand, stone, doors and other items).

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 24 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida a salir adelante. Su pareja es Rony,  quien es comerciante y el padre de sus dos hijos: Rony de 4 años y Romina de 3. Juntos viven en la casa que les prestó un amigo mientas está de viaje.

Su negocio es la venta de madera, la cual compra de un aserradero y la almacena en su vivienda. Este negocio lo realiza con la ayuda de su pareja, con quien atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, principalmente los carpinteros de los alrededores. Inicio hace más de un año con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue aumentando al ver la demanda. Antes de empezar tenía dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de sus hijos, pues ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con ello para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más madera para tener disponible para venta, ya que los precios están subiendo.
texts.en:
Lucila is 24 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who is determined to succeed.  Her partner is Rony, who works as a merchant.  He is the father of her two children: Rony, 4 years old, and Romina, 3 years old.  They live together in a house they are borrowing from a friend while he is on a trip.

Her business is selling wood, which she purchases from a sawmill and stores in her home.  She does this work with the help of her partner, who very kindly takes care of the customers, who are mainly local carpenters.  She started the business more than a year ago with her own money.  She began purchasing in small quantities and slowly increased the quantity upon seeing the demand.  Before starting the business, she had financial difficulties as expenses increased with the arrival of her children, but she wants to give them a better quality of life and a good education.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she counts on them to continue with her goals.  She likes the work that the community bank does to support people in moving forward with their businesses.

With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase more wood to have it available for sale, since prices are rising.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Pinto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos destes 3 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mobília para a sua casa (mesa, cadeiras e outros) para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
No futuro deseja abrir uma serigrafia para aumentar a sua renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de transporte pessoal para conseguir ir e voltar do serviço sem dificuldades.
texts.en:
Pinto is a married father of 4 children, of whom 3 attend school. He lives in his own home and does not financially support anyone else.
He is a teacher and a member of staff at the Ministry of Education, and with this loan he intends to buy furniture for his home (table, chairs and other items) in order to offer his family greater comfort.
In the future he hopes to open a silk-screen printing business in order to increase his monthly income; consequently, he promises to adhere to the repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is his lack of personal transport which would make his journey to and from work easier.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home (table, chairs and other items) to offer his family greater comfort.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y con deseos de superación. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos, pero tiene una nueva relación buscando rehacer su vida. Vive en compañía de su actual pareja y sus tres hijos, en su casa propia, la que construyó con su anterior pareja.

Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, luego compró dos máquinas de coser para empezar su negocio, instalando su pequeño taller en su vivienda. Actualmente, ya cuenta con tres máquinas que fue comprando con sus ganancias y préstamos anteriores con MFP. Lleva realizando este oficio 4 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Le gusta hacer el oficio que tanto le gusta, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, quienes son  su mayor motivación para seguir esforzándose. El problema de este trabajo es tener que permanecer sentada en una misma postura, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando. Sus planes a futuro son de instalar un taller de confecciones mejor implementado en su casa.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea continuar con este apoyo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura, especialmente para la confección de lencería (telas, hilos y otros).
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old. She is a very happy woman who hopes to get ahead in life. She is separated from the father of her three children, but she is looking to restart her life with her new relationship. She lives with her current partner and her three children in her own home, which she built with her previous partner.

She sews. She learned her trade by studying at a job training center, and then purchased two sewing machines to begin her business. Her little workshop is in her house. Currently, she has three sewing machines, which she purchased through her earnings and previous loans with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She has been working this way for four years, and she has been working by herself up to today. She likes working at a trade that she enjoys. Through her work she is able to cover her living costs and her children’s education. Her children are her biggest motivation to continue growing. Her work requires her stay seated in the same position, which sometimes causes her back to ache, but she does not get discouraged and continues working. Her future plans are to make a better equipped workshop in her house.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support she keeps receiving, and she hopes to continue receiving it. As a result, she is committed to making her loan payments on time, as she has done with previous loans.
She will invest the requested amount, 1000 PEN [$400] by purchasing sewing materials, specifically to make lingerie (fabric, thread, and other items).

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials to make lingerie.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 62 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Está casada con Jorge, quien es transportista y padre de su único hijo. Vive sólo con su pareja porque su hijo es independiente.

Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Se inició por la recomendación de su amiga hace 5 años y desde entonces cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien siempre la transporta para la entrega y el cobro de los pedidos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, con lo cual puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Le gusta socializar y hacer nuevas amistades, así incrementa sus clientes. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, el dinero que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para todos los gastos. Ahora tiene planes de instalar un local amplio en su casa donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza y bebidas.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por eso cuenta con este apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en su crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 62 years old, is an experienced woman when it comes to businesses. She is also a happy and kind woman. She is married to Jorge, who is a shipping carrier and the father of their only son. Her and her husband live by themselves now since their son is independent.

Mercedes sells beauty products through a catalogue. She began after a friend's recommendation five years ago and since then, she depends on her husband's help, who transports her so she can make deliveries and take orders. She considers her business to be fairly profitable due to the income she earns. With this income, she can help her husband with household expenses. She likes to sell and make new friends, which then increases her customer base. Before she started this business, she had many economic problems. The money that her husband earned was not sufficient to cover their expenses. Now she plans to set up a spacious shop in her home where she can sell her beauty products as well as drinks.

This is Mercedes's second loan with MFP, and she is counting on this help in order to continue with her goals. She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, just as she was with her previous loan.

With the requested sum, 2000 nuevo soles, she will invest in buying more beauty products and increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rita Maria continua logrando su gran sueño, terminar su casa, junto a su esposa han hido avanzando en lo que mas pueden y con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo van saliendo adelante, con este nuevo financiamiento que le han otorgado ellos daran un ultimo acabado en el techo de la casa compraran materiales como: tubos, perlines, soldadores, sierras, galones de pinturas anticorresivas.
muy contenta doña Rita nos comenta que ya esta cerca de  ver cumplido su sueño.
texts.en:
Rita Maria continues working alongside her spouse toward their dream of finishing construction on their home. With much sacrifice and effort, they are making progress. With the support from this loan, they plan to finish the roof and purchase additional construction materials such as tubes, welders, saws, gallons of anti-corrosive paint and other materials.

Rita says that she is very happy, and is close to fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as welders, tubes, paint and other items.

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es:
Don Rolando habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, en la comarca La Borgoña, muy esforzado y trabajador, el obtiene ingresos propios ya que labora como Jardinero para una institucion muy grande, el tiene como responsabilidad a su hermana, el la apoya con los gastos de sus estudios y quiere mejorar de vida, ademas el señor Rolando es agricultor en estos momento tiene una cosecha de una manzana de arboles de Aguacate, y con este fianciamiento podra realizarle un mantenimiento comprara. 12 quintales de completa 12-30-10 para que su cosecha sea de buena calidad y asi podre vendaerla en buen precio.
muy agradecido con Afodenic quien con fondo KIVA ayudan a personas necesitadas.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the county of La Borgoña. He is very determined and hard-working. He earns his own income, since he works as a gardener for a very large institution. He has family responsibilities for his sister; he supports her with the expenses for her studies, and he wants to help improve her life. In addition, Rolando is a farmer. At this time, he has a grove of avocado trees preparing for harvest, and with this loan he will be able to maintain his crop. He will buy 12 quintals [large sacks] of 12-30-10 fertilizer so that his harvest will be of good quality, and thus he will be able to sell it for a good price. 

He is very grateful to Afodenic, which, with the KIVA fund, helps people in need.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain a grove of avocado trees.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old. She is married and has one child. She has been running a retail shop for two years with a monthly income of 29,900 Kenyan Shillings. 

Susan has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more washing detergents, tea leaves, blue band, and soft drinks to sell.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her child's school fees. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she successfully paid back the previous loan. Her hope is to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more washing detergents, tea leaves, blue band, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair the roof of her home and tile her kitchen
